loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra R. P. has been selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya Market for ten years.  She needs this loan because her business is growing.  Silvestra will use the loan to buy tamarind, avacado, oranges, plums and other fruits in season.

Silvestra has participated in ADIM’s personal and business development program; it teaches women how to recognize and improve self-esteem, manage their small business efficiently, and empower individuals. She said the program has really helped with the performance of her business , her perception of herself, and her personal relationships.

loans.use: To buy fruits in season

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène GUEYE est une veuve de 40 ans, avec en charge 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés et de céréales telles que mil et arachide. Ce commerce lui permet de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène G. is a 40-year-old widow and cares for her four children. She sells smoked and dried fish as well as cereals, such as millet and peanuts. This business enables her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried and smoked fish as well as cereals

loans.name: Celinda Victoria

texts.es:
Celinda tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus hermanos y una sobrina en el distrito de Zaña, una zona ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Por más de 30 años se ha dedicado a la preparación y venta de dulces típicos y gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante. Ella prepara diversos dulces típicos como turrones de ajonjolí,jaleas, chocotejas y conserva de frutas para venderlos en su establecimiento a los turistas que visitan la zona para observar algunas ruinas coloniales. El negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para seguir adelante.

Celinda desea ampliar su negocio y empezar a distribuir los productos en otros establecimientos de la zona, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar mas dulces y asi lograr su objetivo.

Celinda es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Celinda, age 62, is single and lives with her brothers and a niece in the Zaña district, an area located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 30 years she has been involved in the preparation and sale of traditional candies, and, thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead.

She makes several types of sweets including turrones de ajonjolí (nougat with sesame seeds), jellies, chocotejas (a candy made from a mixture of chocolate and caramel), and fruit preserves. She sells them in her shop to tourists who visit the area to see some colonial ruins. The business is her only source of income. She tries to improve it so that she can continue to progress.

Celinda wants to enlarge her business and begin distributing her products in other shops in her area. That’s why she has seen the need to apply with Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 new soles. She plans to invest this in the purchase of raw materials for preparing more sweets in order to meet her objective. Celinda is a very hardworking woman who enjoys her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her an honorable and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the preparation of sweets.

loans.name: Heydi Sugey

texts.es: Heydi tiene 32 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos  a su cargo, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios. La ubicación de su negocio en es un pequeño establecimiento en el mercado, es aquí donde ofrece leche, cuajada, queso y mantequilla. El dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para su actividad. el deseo de ella es mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Heydi, age 32, sells dairy products. She has been in this business for over 11 years. She has two children under her care, and she has always been concerned about improving her income and giving her children the necessary education. Her business is a small establishment, which is located in the market. That is where she sells milk, “cuajada” (a type of soft cheese), cheese, and butter. The requested money is to buy raw material for her activity. Her wish is to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Transformation of cassava into cassava flour, which is then sold

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Omar S. est 35 ans et vit à Ziguinchor, la plus grande ville de la région de la Casamance au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et sans enfants, afin qu'il se concentre sur son travail. Pour les 3 dernières années, il a fait des robes haut de gamme pour les femmes à Ziguinchor. Il achète en tissu de haute qualité dans la ville de Tambacounda, qui est proche de la frontière du Mali, d'où le tissu provient. Il conçoit les robes lui-même et les vend pour $60. Il aime son travail et avec le prêt de Kiva, il veut acheter plus de tissu pour maintenir son entreprise. Il employe deux autres travailleurs qui l'aident à faire les robes.
texts.en:
Omart S. is 35years old; he lives in Zuguinchor, the largest city in the Casamance region of Senegal. He is single without children, and thus he dedicates himself fully to his work. For the last three years, he has been sewing high-quality women’s dresses in Zuguinchor. He purchases high-end fabrics in the town of Tambacounda, near the border with Mali, which is where the fabrics are produced. He designs the dresses himself and sells them for $60. He loves his work and would like to use Kiva’s loan to purchase more fabrics for his business. He employs two other people who help him make the dresses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making garments

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luís R. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar mercancía para el negocio. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder comprar una maquina mas moderna para revisión de los diagnósticos de los carros que tiene para repararlos, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Santa Álvarez esposa del señor José Luís R..
texts.en:
José Luís R. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. He was able to buy merchandise for his business with the loan. He is asking for a new loan to be able to buy a more modern machine. The machine is to perform diagnostic checks on the cars that he has to repair. At this time he does not have the money for this, and he does not want to take money out of the business. He plans to pay the loan with part of his earnings from the business. The business is the source of income for the family. The person appearing in the photo is Santa Álvarez, José Luís R.’s wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a more modern diagnostic machine

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T., 47, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. T. is a construction worker and earns an income of USD 3.90 per day. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of about USD 1.50 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s wife appears in the photograph.

loans.use: repair their house

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: Margarito G. de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus 6 hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 9 y los 20 años de edad. Margarito posee un cultivo de maíz en el cual se encarga de plantar y cuidar durante todo el tiempo necesario hasta el momento indicado en el cual pueda obtener la cosecha de este, la cual posteriormente se encarga de comercializar con diferentes clientes. Margarito reside junto a su familia en el departamento de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual también se encuentra su cultivo, ha pesar que el trabajo que él realiza es muy bien remunerado, es un trabajo bastante duro, así mismo necesita de mucho cuido sobretodo en la temporada de lluvia la cual puede afectar en muchas ocasiones las matas de maíz. Margarito solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para sembrar en mayores cantidades, así mismo poder comprar frijoles, de forma que tenga un producto más que ofrecer, y abono por mayor para el cuido necesario para las plantaciones. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para él, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a toda su familia. Más de 30 años de experiencia son el mayor respaldo de Margarito, ya que esto le permite contar con la confianza de sus clientes y la agilidad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
46-year old Margarito G. and his wife have six children between the ages of 9 and 20. His wife takes care of the home. Margarito has a piece of land where he grows maize. He plants the crop and takes care of it right up until harvest time. Afterwards he sells the maize to various customers. Margarito and his family live in Ahuachapán department, the same area where he has his fields. Although he gets well paid for his crop, it is very hard work especially during the rainy season when the plants are often affected. Margarito is seeking a loan so that he can buy a larger quantity of maize to plant. He also wants to buy beans so that he has something else to sell, and wholesale fertilizer to provide his fields with the care they need. This venture is very important to him as it is the only means he has of supporting his family. He has more than 30 years of experience in this work so his customers trust him and his product.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sow

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformo mediante el deseo de las señoras de seguir adelante para sacar de la mejor forma a sus familias, y para ello realizan diversas.
Dependiendo de la situación en que se encuentra cada una invierte su crédito en una actividad que le pueda retribuir en un ingreso con ganancias que ellas puedan usar para sus familias.
Así la señora Bibiana invirtió en su crédito en la compra de bebidas para ofrecer en una cantina que ella posee en su casa.
Ella cuenta con muchos clientes de la zona quienes visitan su local frecuentemente en especial en horas de la noche ya también ella ofrece comestibles diversos como empanadas, hamburguesas y pizzas.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to the women’s wish to help their families get ahead in the best way possible. To do so, they are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Depending on each one’s situation, each invests her loan in an activity that will result in income with profits that they can use for their families. Thus, Bibiana used her loan to buy beverages for a bar she has in her home. She has many customers in the area that visit her establishment frequently, especially at night, because she also offers food items like: turnovers, hamburgers and pizzas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like wine and beer.

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Sandagsuren T. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province of western Mongolia. Both of his children go to a local kindergarten while his wife works as a stock keeper in a local private company. 

Sandagsuren manages his own iron/metal work business where he produces such items as stoves, stove pipes, smokestacks, and so on. He began his business in 2003 and has gained much experience over the years. He says, “My dream is to expand my business and establish a workshop of my own.” 

Sandagsuren is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase raw materials for making stoves and other items for the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan in a three-roomed house with her family. She is a 45 year old married lady who has three sons and three daughters. All of the children are getting an education, except the eldest one who left his education after 8th and started to work in an automobile workshop.

Shagufta herself is illiterate, but she knows the importance of education very well. She wants her children to complete their education and for that purpose, she works very hard. She makes and sells artificial flowers sets. She has business contacts with different gift shop owners and supplies them with flowers on order. She also makes decoration pieces from Plaster of Paris. She is very skillful in her art. Her husband does a private job on a monthly wage. 

Shagufta has applied for a loan from Asasah to improve her artificial flower-making business. With the loan money she will buy raw material such as artificial flower petals, plastic sticks in bulk to make flowers in larger quantity and supply them to make a larger income. She hopes that this investment will put a positive impact on her business and she will be able to get good results from it. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. She has maintained good credit behavior in the previous two years of loan experience and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her making artificial flowers business.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Lý Nguyễn Thị (20201020047) is a 25-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Lý is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

Lý is married and has 2 school-age children. To making a living, Lý provides recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lý has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2,300,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (0) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

2.  Nghiêm Thị L. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4.  Nghiêm Thị N. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lý  Nguyễn Thị (20201020047) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Lý  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở các sản phẩm có thể tái chế bằng nhựa hay các sản phẩm có thể tái chế khác cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lý  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lý  kiếm được khoảng 2.300.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Lý  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lý  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Nghiêm Thị L. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  Nghiêm Thị N. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora C. is from the village of Kiabo, Sta. Cruz, Gingoog City. She is 52 years old, married and has 8 adult children. Teodora owns & operates a seafood business, catching and selling seafood products, including fish. Her husband is the fisherman. Teodora is just starting this business.

In 2010, Teodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Santa Cruz, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Maligaya, Brgy. Magara, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store.

Her husband, Sonny C., who is 52 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children, who are 19 to 26 years old and all have their own families. 

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to have something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus lifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and use it as additional capital for the business. Lolita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, D. 46 años, es una mujer que le gusta progresar y triunfar; está casada con Alipio, D. 63 años; ambos tienen 2 hijos, pero viven solos en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural D. Yanapuquio. La agricultura es su principal actividad; con la ayuda D. su esposo siembra, papa; producto bandera D. Julia, ya que su localidad es la principal capital semillero D. papa del Perú, ya tiene 20 años D. experiencia y sus ganancias le permitieron encaminarlos y educarlos. Actualmente posee terrenos D. cultivo, ahí siembra a gran escala las diferentes variedades D. papa y los venD. en el mercado mayorista D. su ciudad. Sin embargo ella está pensando adquirir un camión con el que pueda trasladar sus sacos D. papa; con la ayuda D. su banco comunal ya está logrando ahorrar, por lo que le falta poco, menciona. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y está contenta D. su progreso. Agradece a las personas que intervienen con este aporte para que pueda invertir y desarrollar su negocio.Con el crédito que obtendrá; comprará varias bolsas D. abono orgánico que piensa esparcirlos en sus sembríos D. papa.
texts.en: Julia is 46 years old and is a woman who likes to move forward and succeed.  She is married to 63-year-old Alipio and they both have two children, but they live alone in their own house located in the rural area of Yanapuquio.  Farming is her main business and she grows potatoes with the help of her husband.  They are Julia’s flagship product since her area is the primary potato seedbed in Peru.  She already has 20 years of experience and her earnings allow her to point their children in the right direction and educate them.  She currently owns croplands and she plants large quantities of different varieties of potato there and sells them at her city’s wholesale market.  However, Julia is planning to get a truck which she can use to transport her potato sacks.  With the help of her communal bank, she is already saving and only has a little left to go, she says.  This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is pleased with her progress.  She is grateful for the people who contribute so that she can invest in and develop her business.  With the loan obtained, she will purchase several bags of organic manure that she plans to spread on her potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Buzainap

texts.en:
Buzainap T. is a single mother of two children. She lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Buzainap graduated from trade college and worked as an accountant, but this work was not very profitable and she was not able to cover all of her children's expenses. In order to find a means of supporting her family, Buzainap started a business selling clothing. Using her initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she rented a sales location at the local market and started her business. Thanks to her hardworking and persistent nature, Buzainap managed to buy a flat for her family and increase her turnover. But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Buzainap lost her business, which was robbed and looted.
However, Buzainap doesn’t give up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to renew her range of goods for the coming winter season. Buzainap is very positive person, who believes in a prosperous future for her family and will do her best to achieve it.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her range of goods

loans.name: Geoconda Rebeca

texts.es:
Geoconda de 44 años, es comerciante informal de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 
 
Por la separación de su esposo ella tuvo que conseguir una actividad económica para general dinero y así poder mantener a sus hijos. Fue entonces que decidió invertir sus ahorros en ropa y cosméticos para poder venderlo a sus vecinos y conocidos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella ahora tiene una cartera de clientes definida a quienes les reparte la ropa y algunos cosméticos. Tiene distintos horarios de trabajo y en ocasiones da a crédito la ropa. 

Para seguir con la venta de su mercadería ella quiere comprar ropa y cosméticos para incrementar su capital de trabajo. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Geoconda is 44 years old and an informal clothing and cosmetics vendor. She lives with her husband and their two children in an urban zone called Orquídeas (Orchids), named because many flowers were discovered there, and today there is a park filled with these flowers. 

Because of the separation from her husband, she had to take on an economic activity to generate money in order to be able to support her children. It was then that she decided to invest her savings in clothing and cosmetics to be able to sell them to her neighbors and to other people she knows. With much effort and little by little, she now has a portfolio of regular clients to whom she distributes clothing and some cosmetics. 

She has varying work hours and on occasion she sells the clothing on credit. 

In order to continue with the sales of her merchandise, she wants to buy clothing and cosmetics to increase her business capital. In the future she wants to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: Clothing, cosmetics.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Mr. Am S. is a 48-year-old who lives in Takhmao City. Mr. Am S. is a local fisherman, and he can earn an income of approximately $3 per day. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around the river in his community. He catches around 5 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. 

His wife’s name is Sambok (pictured); she is 44 and has a shop where she sells rice. This couple is blessed with five children, one of whom is single. The remaining four are married, and they are employed as garment worker in a factory.  

Mr. Am S. is concerned that he is obliged to walk to sell his fish and he dreams of having a vehicle to pick up his fish, but he doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Mr. Am S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport his fish to sell

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela R. is a 27 years old and married. She supports her family through buying and selling rice and bananas as well as operating a sari-sari (general) store. Shiela lives in Pag-asa, Brgy. Port barton, San Vicente, Palawan.  

Since 2008, Shiela has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP. 

Shiela is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional store inventory. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loans have all been steps in her journey toward economic freedom. Shiela aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and financial well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word meaning honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Santos Selene

texts.es:
Santos tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría ovejas y cabras en algunos locales situados cerca a su domicilio, las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado, con esta inversión planea aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos, 35, lives with her husband and three children in Las Lomas, an agricultural zone in Peru's Piura region, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos operates a business raising and selling animals. She raises sheep and goats in pens near her house.  She grazes the animals in open pastures and, when they reach an appropriate size, she sells them to locals or to outside buyers passing through the area.  The income from the business allows her to help her husband, a farmer, support the family.

Santos is applying for a loan so that she can buy more animals and a balanced supply of feed for the business.  She says the investment will increase her sales and that the extra income will help her family. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new soles so that she can invest in her business.

loans.use: Buy animals and feed for livestock business.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Camilo, de 46 años, y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Trabajando arduamente, Loida ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, pues todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde el café, cacao y plátano que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo préstamo de Loida con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. 

Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Loida, age 41, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 46 year old husband, Camilo, and their beloved three children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Working arduously, Loida has managed to get ahead with her crops.  She takes her products to sell at the market in the city of Pichanaki.  The coffee, cacao, and bananas that she grows are rapidly sold at the market.

What she likes the most about her work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be having to work the land.  In time, she hopes to be able to buy more land to increase her production.

This is Loida’s second loan with MFP.  She knows that this loan with help her a lot in the progress and development of her business.  That is why she is prepared to make all of her payments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank.  Therefore, she is very well-liked.

She will use the 1,600 soles that she is requesting to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Abarwanashyaka Group

texts.en:
Consolee is 44 years old, married and has five children who range from 14 to 22 years old. She is married to a farmer. 

Consolee is a group leader of a borrowing group called Abarwanashyaka, which means "The Pioneers" in English. The group members sell different items and they have organized themselves to get this loan, which they assume will be helpful in their business. 

Consolee sells beans and drinks. With the help of her colleagues, she requested this loan to buy more beans and drinks to sell. She has been selling these items for a period of eight years. She says the profits she hopes to get will be used to pay school fees and renovate her house. She wishes to raise her loan amount to 300,000 in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yolanie

texts.en:
Yolanie is a married woman who lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  raising pigs and  selling ready-to-wear clothing. Her husband Leopoldo, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 9 children who are 4 to 24 years old with 4 of their children already working while the other 4 are currently going to school. 

Yolanie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Yolanie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for future business expansion. Yolanie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia B. B. tiene  52 años de edad y vive en una de su propiedad. Vivienda que esta ubicada en el Barrio Andalucia de esta ciudad de Tarija. Lidia es madre soltera de 3 hijos, por circunstancias de la vida por una infidelidad por parte de su pareja se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos. Lidia se dedica desde hace mas de 23 años a la elaboracion de salteñas y al servicio y atencion de un salon de belleza. Ambas actividades que realiza son muy reconocidas en esta ciudad.  

Su salon de belleza se denomina "noelia" en el cual ya tiene una variada clientela,  Lidia quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante ella junto con sus 3 hijos , pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprarse mercaderia para tener por un buen tiempo debido a  que los productos que son necesarios estan subiendo de precio. Como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicha mercaderia que es nesesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Lidia nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejora las condiciones de su casa
texts.en:
Lidia B. B. is 52 years old and lives in a house that she owns in the Andalucia neighborhood of the city of Tarija. Lidia is a single mother of three children. Due to life circumstances and her partner's infidelity, she is single and now has to work to be able to get her three children ahead in life. Lidia has worked making ‘salteñas’ (a type of Bolivian baked empanada) and has worked at a beauty salon for more than 23 years. Both of these businesses are well-known in the city.

Her beauty salon is called Noelia and she already has an assorted clientele. Lidia wants to make a better income to get ahead in life with her three children. However, she tells us that she wants to buy merchandise that will last for a while because the items she needs are becoming more expensive. As she already has experience in this area, the loan will be used for the purchase of the merchandise needed to do her job so that she can increase her income.

Lidia tells us that she wants to improve her living conditions. This is why she says that the next loan that she requests will be for improving the condition of her home.

loans.use: Operational capital for her beauty salon

loans.name: Marcellina Mwene

texts.en:
Marcellina W. is 26 years old. She is from Murumba and is married to Gaston.They have two children who are 5 and 3 years old.

Marcellina is a fishmonger and has been in this business for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd and intends to use the money to buy more fish to add to her stock. Her monthly income is 2,200 Kenyan shillings.

She hopes to be the main supplier of fish to major markets.

loans.use: To buy more fish to add to her stock

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Roca está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elba Tomara Silvia Ortiz de 25 años se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años. Ella es casada, tiene un hijo y su meta es tener su casa.
Silvia invertirá en mercadería de verano.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Gloria Elena C. tiene una tortillería desde hace 4 años y Belma Ruth B.  quien es comerciante y tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Roca group is made up of three hard-working, driven and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 25 year-old Elba Tomara Silvia Ortiz who has been selling clothes for 5 years.  She is married, has one child, and her goal is to own her own home.  Silvia will invest her loan in buying summer merchandise.

The other members of the group are Gloria Elena C., who has owned a tortilla bakery for 4 years, and Belma Ruth B. who is a saleswoman and owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, especially shorts, summer shirts, swimsuits, etc.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 50 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Rodrigo works very hard to provide for the family.

Rodrigo runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. He has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.

In the future Rodrigo would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items for his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Songco, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Evangeline is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling canned goods, breads, snack foods, shampoo, soap & instant noodles in the local community. She also sells vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage & celery. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey N. is a businessman who does photography to earn a living.  He is able to provide for his wife and four children with the income from his work. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has gained a lot of business knowledge, which has helped him to run his business better. He aspires to own a studio in the future.  

He has requested a loan of  50,000 KES to buy tapes for video, films and batteries.

loans.use: To buy tapes for video, films and batteries.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Ludy is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Ludy owns and operates a salon, providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ludy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ludy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase needed materials and pay for the utilities. 

Ludy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase needed materials for the maintenance of the salon service. This will be the third loan taken out by Ludy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 48 años, reside en el barrio Santa Rosa de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Crispin, su esposo desde hace 29 años. Ambos tuvieron 7 hijos que con esfuerzo lograron darle lo que necesitan, hoy cuidan de su último hijo Rony. Con la tranquilidad que muestra, forjó su familia. Su principal motor económico e inspiración es “la agricultura”; sus 30 años de experiencia en los cultivos de palta, plátanos y cítricos le ayudaron para adquirir todo lo que hoy tiene. Una casa confortable, locales comerciales en puente Paucartambo (zona comercial), una casa en la capital del país y 40 hectáreas de terrenos cultivables, todo ello gracias a su trabajo continuo. “Yo hago negocio en la chacra”, comenta con mucho orgullo, “mando dos veces a la semana palta en grandes cantidades a la capital”, finaliza. Ahora quiere invertir en el cultivo de café, ya que incremento el precio de venta en el mercado. Ya dio un primer paso con la realización de viveros de café, donde tiene millares de plantitas creciendo para luego ser trasplantadas en los terrenos agrícolas. Además de vender las plantitas a S/. 400 soles por millar a terceras personas, adquiriendo así un dinero extra. Julia, pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Julia, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del personal para trasplantar sus viveros de café en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives in Santa Rosa neighborhood, in the town of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This is where she started her family together with Crispin; her husband of 29 years.  The couple have 7 children and, through their efforts, they have managed to provide them with what they need.  Now they are caring for their youngest son Rony.

With the calmness that she displays, Julia shaped her family.  Her main financial driving force and inspiration is "farming".  She has thirty years experience in growing avocados, bananas and citrus fruits.  This experience helped her to acquire everything that she has now: a comfortable home, business premises in Puente Paucartambo (a commercial area), a home in the country's capital city and 40 hectares of farmland.  She has all of this thanks to her continual work.  "I do business on the farm", she comments very proudly.  "Twice a week, I send large quantities of avocados to the capital", she adds.

Julia would now like to invest in growing coffee since its price on the market has increased.  She has already taken her first step by setting up coffee nurseries, where she has thousands of seedlings growing which will later be transplanted onto her farmland.  She also sells seedlings for 400 Peruvian soles per thousand to third parties which makes her extra money.

Julia is a member of the "Luz del Futuro" (Light of the Future) community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes that you will help fund her loan so that she can continue achieving her goals.  On her part, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  Julia enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Julia will invest the money she has requested in paying laborers to transplant her coffee seedlings onto her farmland.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Wil Alfredo

texts.es:
Will, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 6 y 5 años de edad, solamente él trabaja, él aprendió en talleres y con experiencia instalo su propio negocio, tiene un horario de 8:00am a 4:00pm, su dificultad es el precio de la materia prima, pues constantemente suben los precios.
Actualmente necesita comprar hierro, lija, disco de pulidora, pliegos de lámina, sierras y pintura, pues tiene un contrato pendiente por realizar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la compra y por medio de ella realizar su trabajo.
Él quiere crecer en el taller, con más clientela y al mismo tiempo que su familia tenga una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Will owns a metal shop.  He lives with his wife and his two daughters who are 6 and 5.  He is the only one in the family who works.  Will learned his trade in workshops and he used his experience to set up his own business.  He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.  His main difficulty is the price of raw materials as prices are always rising.

Will currently needs to buy iron, sandpaper, a polishing disc, sheets of metal, saws and paint as he has an outstanding contract.  He is requesting a loan that will help him to make his purchases and thereby carry out his work.

Will would like to grow his workshop and gain more customers.  He would also like his family to be in a better financial position.

loans.use: to buy iron, sandpaper, a polishing disk, sheets of metal, saws and paint

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 38 years old and a resident of Lopez Jaena, is married and has two children. For the past five years, Alma has been selling snacks to earn a living.  A member of PMPC for three years, she is now requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY D. YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Yungaqui, Provincia D. Anta, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maxima; la socia tiene 63 años; la socia es viuda;  La socia se  dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene su terreno D. cultivo D. maíz y verduras;la socia también se dedica a la crianza D.  animales menores, como gallinas, vacas, cuyes. La socia se desea el crédito para comprar abones, pagar el tractor D. la nueva siembra, y comprar animales menores como gallinas para la crianza y la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en al compra D. animales menores especialmente gallinas al por mayor y el pago que traerá el alquiler del tractor, la compra D. abono para el cultivo nuevo.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Taytacha Señor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui" Communal Bank. The bank is in Yungayi District, Anta Province, Cusco Department.

This member is Maxima. She is 63 years old. She is a widow. She works mainly in agriculture, and she has a field for growing corn and vegetables. She also raises small animals like chickens, cows and guinea pigs. Maximilia wants the loan to buy manure, pay the tractor for the latest planting, and buy small animals like chickens to raise and sell. She is asking for the loan to buy small animals, especially chickens, wholesale and to pay the rental fee for the tractor and buy manure for the new crop.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support offered to her through this medium, and she promises to pay her debts on schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals, especially chickens, wholesale and to pay the rental fee for the tractor and buy manure for the new crop.

loans.name: Nessie

texts.en: Nessie is 28 years old and lives in the airport community.  She is a high school graduate who is married and has two children ages 6 and 10 years old. Both her children are in school. Her husband is a pastor. For the past four years, she has been selling oil, rice, flour, sugar and baking powder. She started this business by baking bread. She learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar and baking powder for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, and baking-powder

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns her living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Juditha is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juditha has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from her buy and sell of livestock business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Francisco, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 33, 25 y 21 años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 12 años, estos cultivos le han ayudado a mantener el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para sembrar nuevamente, ya que como esta actividad es la que le provee ingresos, él no quiere dejar de cultivar, por lo que necesita adquirir abono para el cultivo.
Las aspiraciones de don Francisco es realizar cada vez mejor las cosechas, continuar produciendo la tierra para que también su familia siga contando con esta fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and three children, ages 33, 25, and 21.  He has been growing vegetables for 12 years. These crops have helped him support his family. 

Now he is applying for a loan to buy supplies for planting once again, since this is how he earns income.  He doesn't want to stop farming and this is why he needs to acquire fertilizer for his crops.  

Francisco's ambition is to produce better and better harvests,  ensuring that his land remains productive, so that his family continues to have this source of income.

loans.use: To buy crop fertilizer.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 35-year-old man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family falls on him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. For six years he has been operating a retail shop despite the challenges of the current inflation rate, and his dream is to trade in wholesale. Steven needs the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alfred B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 9,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) from Kiva field partner SMT. With the help of this loan, they are going to solve most of their immediate financial needs, and at the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and paying SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

Alfred is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Sumbuya, southern Sierra Leone, the 57-year-old has served in the teaching profession for 36 years. He is married and has three children: two in secondary school and one no longer attending school. Alfred has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lateefa

texts.en: Lateefa is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband and her son are workers with decent salaries. Lateefa makes embroideries and her daughters help her in this project. Because of high customer demand to buy and get these Palestinian traditional embroideries, Lateefa wants to expand her project and purchase more beads and textiles. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Lateefa gets the loan, she will be able to purchase beads and textiles for embroideries and has a better collection to sell. This will increase her income and enable her to offer better life conditions to her family. Lateefa is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing beads and textiles for embroideries.

loans.name: Gregoria Ccasani

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, es socia D. Finca Peru desD. hace 16 años. Gregoria venD. chicha y jugo D. naranja, antes vendía fruta en un mercado, con la ayuda D. los préstamos reibidos se compró un triciclo y posteriormente compró parlantes para alquilar.
Gregoria pudo obtener muchas cosas gracias a los préstamos, esta muy agradecida porque le enseñaron muchas cosas, tales como aumentar su negocio, como poder tener una buena relación familiar, todos estos años que es socia aprendió a querer mucho a Finca y se siente parte D. esta familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. maíz, azúcar.
texts.en:
Gregoria’s a member of the “Lirio” communal bank and a member of Finca Perú for the last 16 years.  Gregoria sells chicha [beverage maD. from corn] and orange juice.  She used to sell fruit in the market.  With help from the loans she got she was able to buy a three-wheel cart and later on bought loudspeakers to lease.

Gregoria was able to acquire many things thanks to the loans. She’s very grateful because they taught her many things like how to increase business and have better family relations.  In all the years she’s been a member she’s grown to love Finca very much and she feels like she’s part of a family.  The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy corn and sugar.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been in the pool business in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 29 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his second loan.  He repaid all of his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another pool table to add to the one that he has, and thus, be able to accommodate more clients.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business and open one of the leading entertainment spots in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy a pool table.

loans.name: Tres Fronteras Group

texts.es:
Tres fronteras lleva el nombre D. este comité D. la ciudad D. Luque, las 21 integrantes son vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, todas ellas se unieron con la esperanza D. un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y familiares. Ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia que quieren luchar para salir adelante.
La sra. Berna, es una D. las miembros, trabaja en artesanía D. karanday (un tipo D. madera),está acompañada hace 11 años con el señor Lucilo quien trabaja como vendedor D. las artesanía en karanday que ella hace, tienen cuatro  hijos menores que todavía van a la escuela. Ella comenta que juntos se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. karanday, el cual es el instrumento esencial para la elaboración D. sus artesanías.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Luque is known as "Tres Fronteras". There are 21 members who are neighbors and friends. They all meet with the hope of a better future for their children and families. The women are heads of their families that want to fight in order to get ahead. 

One of the members, Berna, is a craftswoman, working with karanday (a type of wood). She has been with her partner Lucilo for 11 years, who works selling the products that she makes. They have 4 young children who are in school. She tells us that together they are helping themselves to move forward.

She asks for a loan to buy karanday, which is the main material that she needs to make her crafts.

loans.use: to buy wood to make artisan crafts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 40-year-old, married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been farming for 20 years. He has the challenge of unpredictable weather. His dream is to buy land and grow more crops. He intends to use the loan facility to pay workers who are weeding his garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden

loans.name: Dushyigikirane No 24 A/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Onésphore fait partie du groupe Dushyigikirane 24 A/Rsz. Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 4 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Onésphore est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Onésphore voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Onésphore belongs to the Dushyigikirane 24 A/Rsz group.  He is 35 years old and is married with three children, ranging from four to nine years old.  Two children are in school.  He has eight years of elementary school education.  Onésphore grows rice.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.  His strategy to grow his business is to use selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Onésphore would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide them with schooling.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married to Kibe.

She has been into her business for the last 12 years, from which she earns a monthly income of 27,100 KES. She is applying for her fifth loan of 40,000 KES. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Mary hopes to use the loan to buy a dairy cow and to open up a milk-selling depot in the nearby trading center.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for breeding

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 30 and married with two children. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat. He also has [dairy] cows and sells milk and milk products. He has six years of experience, which qualifies him as a knowledgeable and skilled person. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and resells them in the livestock bazaar for meat. Looking after cattle is hard and requires spending a lot of time in the open air. The climate is very severe; it is very hot in the summer and very cold in winter. However, Elnur is not alone in his business; his wife helps to pasture and feed the animals. Meat and milk products are popular products in Azerbaijan. People drink fresh milk and home-made yogurt everyday and consider it very healthy. Every national dish consists of meat like pilau and dolma. Elnur's monthly profit is 250 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). He wishes to expand his business to improve life for his family. For this purpose, he applied for a 800 AZN loan. He will use this loan to purchase one milk cow and fodder. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single parent and has 2 children. She produces gari for sale at Abuenu, which she has done for 6 years. Grace uses her income to feed their children and take care of other family expenses. Grace will use the loan to purchase cassava for the production of her gari for sale. With the new profits from her business, Grace plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava for the production of her gari for sale

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a mother of 2, ages 10 and 6 years, and has been in active farming for 4 years. She runs a retail shop as well and sells her farm produce of bananas and maize to the local market.

Dinah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. She says this will help her maintain her production and income, especially from banana farming, since she will be able to carry out farming across seasons.

She points to lack of finances as the greatest challenge to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with four children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.  She works  on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of build rental houses to supplement her income.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is an experience baker.  She has been in the bread making for over 15years in the Sekondi-Takoradi metropolis. The appetizing nature of her bakery products attract several clients to her shop to purchase her product especially bread. She has participated in two TEACH lending programmes. She has developed her business and marketing plan. In realising that, she has increased her sales due to the high demand for her products she has decided to increase her production levels hence, the request for KIVA loan of $750 to enable her purchase an additional oven in order to expand her bakery business operations.

loans.use: expands business - purchase second oven

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 28 years old and a single parent with 1 child. She prepares for sale a local food made from semi-dry cassava flour and eaten with fried fish. She wants to use the KIVA loan to erect a shed to sell her food. She hopes this will ensure a hygienic environment for her clients. It will also allow her to meet the food safety standards required by city authorities.

loans.use: Construction of a shed

loans.name: Makhira

texts.en:
Makhira is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement and she is single.

She has run this business for 5 years. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought cosmetics. The second time she borrowed a loan of $800 and bought cosmetics and cut glasses. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of her shop.

loans.use: Makhira would like to expand the area of her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Djoukey

texts.fr:
A married father of eleven (11) children, Mr. Djoukey A. was born in 1956 in Tannou, where he currently lives. A farmer for 30 years, he has mastered farming techniques and always makes good agricultural harvests, especially when the climatic conditions are favourable. The good yield he realizes is in general due to the seeds he uses. His current seeds have already been used for 4 years and are beginning to lose their productivity and need to be renewed or replaced by new ones. However, the lack of investment capital is a current problem. For this, Mr. A. is asking for a loan of $800 to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him financial means to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de onze (11) enfants, Monsieur A. Djoukey est né en 1956 à Tannou où il réside actuellement. Agriculteur depuis 30 ans, il maîtrise les techniques cultirales et fait toujours de bonnes campagnes agricoles surtout lorsque les conditions climatiques sont favorables. Les bons scores qu'il réalise sont généralement dûs aux semences qu'il utilise. Ses semences actuelles sont déjà utilisées pendant 4 ans et commence par perdre leurs capacité de production et ont besoin d'être renouvellées ou d'être substituées par de nouvelles. Cependant le manque de capital d'investissement constitue un problème actuel. Pour cela, Monsieur A. sollicite un fond de $800 pour acheter des semences sélectionnées et des fertilisants pour redynamiser son activité. L'amélioration de son rendements lui donnera une force financières pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy selected seeds and fertilisers to re-engergize his farming

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha T., 38, earns $2.50 a day selling vegetables. Her husband is a teacher, who earns $2 a day. She has 5 children; 3 are students and 2 work in the garment factory.

She is applying for this loan so that she can buy a motorcycle for her husband to enable him to become a taxi driver when he is not busy teaching. She intends to use the remainder of the money to renovate her house, which has fallen into disrepair.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience I. is 30 years old, is married, and has five children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells eggs. She spent three months learning the business and has two years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $400 to enable her to buy more eggs to sell. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: This man lives in Khachmaz town and is single. He was born in 1982. Rashad has sold clothes for two years. Now he needs a loan of  $775 to buy clothes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun P., 49, works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing crops and various kinds of vegetables making collectively about $5 each day. She has three children. One of them is employed at a nearby garment factory; another one is a blacksmith and the rest of are married and live separately. Mrs. Phun P. hopes to use this loan to purchase more blacksmith's supplies and other tools for her son to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more blacksmith's supplies and other tools for her son to reinvest in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Kipunguni Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 32, is married and owns a video library where she works from 8am to 7pm daily. She started this business in 2007 and now makes a monthly profit of about $180 from her rentals.

Elizabeth now hopes for a loan to increase her video stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup. They belong to the loan group called Kipunguni, whose members keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is 1st on the right ,standing

loans.use: To purchase more video stock for her library

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
I would like to make my home more secure.  I want to make the fence higher on one side, and I’ve also wanted to paint the house for years because the humidity has deteriorated the walls.  I am requesting $800 for the construction of the fence and to paint my house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Me gustaría darle a mi vivienda más seguridad por eso quiero levantar más la barda que esta a un lado, también quiero pintar la casa ya que los años, la lluvia y la humedad han deteriorado las paredes. Solicito $ 800 para la construcción de la barda y pintar mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a fence and paint the house

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
We have been making improvements to the house but we still need to waterproof the roof and finish the exterior. At the moment, however, we don't have all the funds we need to do the work. We're applying for a $1,200 loan to waterproof the roof before the upcoming rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tiempo le hemos estado haciendo mejoras a la casa pero nada mas nos esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar el techo y los acabados del exterior de la casa. Pero por el mometo no tenemos le monto necesario para realizar estos detalles. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para impermeabilizar el techo ya que se esta presentando la temporada de lluvias.

loans.use: Waterproofing and exterior finishes.

loans.name: Oyebola

texts.en: Oyebola M. lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, drinks and food, a business that she has been operating for the past 12 years. She is 37 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more clothes, drinks and food to sell. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, clothes and food to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Olga (pictured in the center) lives in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Olga lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 and 2. She owns and manages her own business selling clothing, shoes, and undergarments as well as jewelery and bed sheets. Her business has continued to grow since she has had greater access to capital through the loans that Esperanza Internacional has given her. She has successfully paid off two loans already and would like to purchase more clothing, shoes, and undergarments to sell in her store with this next loan.

Olga has worked very hard to get to where she is today and will continue to do so in order to grow her business, support her family, and progress as an individual. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Olga herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and undergarments

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat baji is a wife of M. T. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a three-room brick house. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her son runs a grocery shop. Her daughter is in 8th standard. Her husband is a milk seller and has been in this profession for the last 12 years. In Pakistan, milk is typically sold door-to-door each day. Farhat baji is a housewife and prefers to stay home and do housework. Farhat baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy more materials (rice, lentils) for her son's grocery shop and to buy more milk for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by: Sardaran baji, Shahnaz baji and Ruqaiya baji who are requesting loans to buy more fruits for their fruit businesses; and Bilquis baji who requests a loan to buy more materials for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Chanbopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanbopha D., 45, is a food seller. She sells Khmer noodles and desserts in her village, earning US$ 3.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Choun Kheang, is a village doctor, earning about US$ 5.00 per day. Chanbopha has five children, all of whom are students. They are living in Snam Pras Commune, Pursat Province.

To reduce the family's expenses for traveling and transportation, Chanbopha had a discussion with her husband and decided to request a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorcycle to use to reduce the family's expenses related to traveling to work and school. The loan will help them keep more profit to support their family's living expenses adequately.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for the family

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia lives in Benin City with her husband and 9 children.  She has been a LAPO borrower for 2 years and is working hard to grow her business.  

She learned her trade from her mother who sold foodstuffs throughout Felicia's childhood.  Felicia opened her own shop in 2000, hoping to become a major distributor in the foodstuffs business.  She's still working toward that goal, but, as many Nigerian traders will tell you, "capital is our problem."
