Actuellement il mène plusieurs activités pour lui même, notamment la vente des téléphones portables et autres. Il est très bien sollicité par ses clients,  car il vend des portables de meilleurs qualités.   
 Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mr D. a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  il est à son  premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce prêt  il compte acheter 10 portables et des pièces de rechanges, il s’approvisionne  à Bamako ( capitale du Mali ) et souvent à Lomé ( Togo ) et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes au comptant.
 Mr D. compte sur  225 000 FCFA  de bénéfice par mois qui lui servira à subvenir à ses besoins et au remboursement du prêt.. 
Il ambitionne agrandir sa boutique pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mr Samba D., 30, is married and the father of one child. He is monogamous and lives with his wife and child in the Médina Coura neighborhood of the town of Koutiala ( Sikasso region).

Samba did not go to French school, but he did 6 years of Koranic school before beginning to earn money together with his older brother, 15 years ago. Presently he is working in several businesses for himself, notably selling mobile telephones and others. He is much sought after by his customers, since he sells the best quality mobile phones.

In order to satisfy his customers' needs appropriately, Mr. D. came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this loan he expects to buy 10 mobile phones and spare parts. He buys his merchandise in Bamako (capital of Mali) and often in Lomé (Togo) and makes his sales in his shop in the big open-air market of Koutiala to a clientele made up of women and men, on a cash basis.

Mr. D. counts on making 225,000 F CFA in profit per month, which he will use for his own needs and to reimburse the loan. His ambition is to enlarge his shop so as to attract more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of portable telephones for re-sale

loans.name: Mirzomurod

texts.en:
Mirzomurod is 52 years old, and he has been married since the age of 26 to the mother of his 4 children. Mirzomurod has worked in agriculture since he was young. His father taught him how to responsibly work with each crop, and now, with the help of his wife and adult children, he feels a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the market.

Mirzomurod would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children, and in this way improve his quality of life. The money that he is soliciting is for the purchase of seeds, chemical fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Разоков Гулом проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 31 год, женат и имеет троих детей. Работает водителем такси. Автомобиль его собственный  , нуждается в ремонте , поэтому для этого он решил получить кредит  и купить автозапчасти.Если он не произведет ремонт своевременно его семья останется без дохода. Кредит поможет ему обеспечить себя работой и доходом.
texts.en:
Gulom R. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. He works as a taxi driver. He uses own car and it is in need of repairs and this is why he has decided to apply for a loan to buy auto parts. If he does not make the repairs on time his family will be left without income. The loan will help provide him with work and income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Mohammad Taher

texts.en: Mohammad Taher is the son of G. A.. He lives in the 6th district of Kabul in Afghanistan. He is fifty years old and married with six children. He is a hard working man who likes having a successful business. He has a shop in which he sells oil, flour and different kinds of cereal. He would like to expand his business and increase his monthly income, so he wants to take out a loan. He says that this kind of program is very helpful for the progress of poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Murotali

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муротали житель г. Гафурова , женат имеет троих детей, возраст 43 года. Работает в санатории "Шифо" заместителем директора.Его доход с этой работы не большой , поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход с откорма и продажи скота.У него много запаса корма для своих коров.На снимке Муротали в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Murotali, a resident of the city of Gafurova, is married, has three children and is 43 years old. He works as the deputy director in the Shifo sanitorium. His salary with this job is not large, and therefore he has supplementary income with the care and sale of cattle. He has a large supply of fodder for his cows. In the picture, Murotali is at the bank on payday. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: El Hadji Ngary

texts.fr: El hadji Ngary  K. est un commerçant, il vend de l’aliment de bétail et du charbon de bois. ce célibataire de23 ans a quitté l’école très top pour se lancer dans le commerce a fin d’aider ses parents dont le niveau de revenu est très bas. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’entretenir ses parents mais aussi de faires quels économies pour préparer son mariage. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il veut accroitre son commerce en achetant plus de marchandises pour la saison des pluies période pendant laquelle les aliments de bétail se vendent chère.
texts.en:
El Hadji Ngary K. is a storekeeper who sells animal feed and charcoal. Single and 23 years old, he left school very early to start a business in order to help his parents, whose level of income is very low. The money he makes from his business enables him to provide for his parents as well as save up for when he gets married. He wants to use this loan to expand his business by buying more merchandise in time for the rainy season, when animal feed commands a high price.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a small grocery store in Nikopol City and has been in this business for fifteen years. She chose food sales because food is something people will always buy.

The store has a good location that brings in many customers. Olga makes sure that her products are always fresh and good quality. She has many repeat and thankful clients and the store brings her a stable income.

Olga would like to borrow 12,100 UAH to purchase more inventory. She has used small business loans before and considers them very helpful.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mgreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Idunda borrower group,In Kihesa,Iringa.she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 36,30,28 years.

magreth started her own  business selling charcoal 13 years ago,she works 14 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Magreth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested loan amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Magreth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Dependable Group

texts.en:
Theresa is forty-three years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the children. She prepares and bakes bread. She started her operations with her mother when she was a little girl.  In spite of the challenges she faces, she has managed to acquire a portion of land where she wants to build her own house. It is her bread business that brings hope to the family and support from her husband. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demand. She requests a loan to allow her to remain in business, and she also wants to save some of her profits for her children's education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Dependable’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral in order to access the loan, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badeya de l’association Assurance ( 2 femmes mariées, 2 veuves et une célibataire), avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent  majoritairement  dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.   
Elles font du vrai commerce d’articles divers comme activités, avec la vente de poissons (sous diverses formes), d’atiécké, de fruits, d’encens, des prestations de teinture etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Tous les six précédents  prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 paniers de poissons fumés et séchés, 10 sacs d’atiécké, 4 régimes de bananes,  2 sacs d’ananas, 10 paniers d’oranges, 5 sachets de 5kg de colorants différents, 1 barrique de  soude caustique, 15 kg de graines de magnon et de guenni, 6 types différents de parfums et des bouteilles vides servant d’emballages pour l’encenses. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les  différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée comme  épargne et pour subvenir aux  besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente ou aménager leur lieu de prestation de teinture.
texts.en:
The members of this Badeya group, belonging to the ‘Assurance’ Association (2 married women, 2 widows, and one single woman) have an average age of 39 and on average, 4 children, and live primarily in polygamous families in Mancourani 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They have real businesses, selling various items such as fish (in various forms), ‘atiéké’ (cassava grits), fruit, incense, and dyeing cloth. They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 7th solidarity loan. The preceding 6 loans were correctly reimbursed.

With their new loan they intend to buy 4 baskets of smoked and dried fish, 10 sacks of ‘atiéké’, 4 stalks of bananas, 2 sacks of pineapple, 10 baskets of oranges, 5 bags of 5 kg each of various dyes, 1 barrel of caustic soda, 15 kg of ‘magnon’ and ‘guenni’ seeds, 6 various sorts of perfume, and empty bottles that they will use for their incense. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and on foot in the neighborhoods, for cash and occasionally for credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make a monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. Some of the women hope to buy a plot of land to build a home on in Sikasso town; others hope to open up a store or upgrade the place where they do their cloth dyeing.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
Ignacia T. is the group coordinator of the group Mujeres Emprendedoras 3 (Entrepreneurial Women). Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) and Dominican clients. She lives in Puerto Plata, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, is unmarried and does not have children. She lives in a town without clean running water and without a reliable supply of electricity.

To make a living, Ignacia has been selling clothes for about a year now. She would like a loan to purchase more clothes to appeal to more customers. She dreams of one day having a permanent storefront.

This is Ignacia's second loan with Esperanza. She says that Esperanza has maD. a large impact in her life by giving her the means to expand her business and the ability to better proviD. for herself.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory/merchandise.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen P. is a 45 year-old widow who has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. She has three children who stay at home making brooms for her to sell. The brooms are made from a kind of long grass that grows in the forest. She earns approximately $4 each day.

Chen learned how to make brooms from her neighbors and started her business in 2004. She told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around $45 on food and $5 on utilities. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's local partner Credit to purchase the long grass in bulk. This will save money and allow her to increase the number of brooms she can make and sell.

loans.use: To buy materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D. est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de Baye laye,une femme qui a atteint le troisième age mais très dynamique qui a initie ses enfants a ses activités et qui a presque fait adhérer tous ses enfants.Elle a cinq enfants presque tous majeurs et cinq autres personnes en charges.Son activité principale est la transformation de céréales locales qu'elle a exerce pendant trois ans.Elle évolue aussi dans l'élevage de bovins et l'aviculture pendant dix ans.Elle a longtemps évolue dans le développement sociale et a eu a faire beaucoup d'actions sociales en aidant certains démunis jusqu'à avoir le gout du métier.Ses revenus mensuels varient entre 854 000 frs et 1 154 000 frs.L'accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettent de diversifier ses produits et services commercialises et de mieux supporter les charges familiales.Elle vit avec son mari ,un navigateur en retraite.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou D., a former member of the branch office of Baye Laye, is a woman who has reached her sunset year, though she is very energetic.  She has introduced her children to her businesses and has almost gotten all of her children to join in.  She has five children, almost all of them adults, plus she has five other people in her care.  Her principal business is processing local grains, something she has been doing for three years.  She has also been developing her businesses raising cattle and poultry for ten years.  For quite awhile, she has made advances in societal development and has acted many times socially by helping certain disadvantaged people to enjoy having a trade.  Her monthly revenues vary from 854,000 to 1,154,000 francs.  The growth in her profits enables her to diversify her commercialized goods and services and to cover family expenses better.  She lives with her husband, a retired navigator.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Gencys

texts.es:
Gencys tienen 29 años, está casado y es padre de un hijo; con su familia, vive en su casa propia. 

Él se dedica a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantas de café, plátanos y piñas en sus propias chacras. De todos los productos, el más trabajoso es la piña, ya que debe trabajar 9 meses abonando y fumigando, porque en tiempos de siega se puede cosechar hasta tres veces, por ello para Gencys, no le resulta cansado por más que sea trabajoso. 
Con esta cosecha más la recolección de café, su familia no pasa necesidades económicas, es por ello que está prensando incrementar sus cultivos, asimismo le gustaría dedicarse a la venta de motos, ya que en su pueblo carecen de movilidad. 

Con su primer crédito pudo sembrar sus chacras de piñas y ahora con este segundo quiere fortalecer sus tierras, para ello se comprometo pagar puntualmente como hasta ahora. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, con los que va abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gencys, 29, is married and the father of one son. He lives with his family in his own house. He cultivates coffee plants, pineapples and bananas on his own farmlands. Of all the products, the most difficult one is the pineapple which must be worked for 9 months, fertilized and fumigated, because in times of reaping it can be harvested up to three times. Because of that, Gencys doesn't find it tiring no matter how much work it entails. With this harvest, added to the coffee gleaning, his family does not suffer economic hardships so he is thinking about increasing his plantings as well as perhaps going into motorcycle sales because in his town mobility is lacking. With his first loan he was able to plant pineapple on his farmland and with this second loan he wants to fortify the soil and he promisses to repay on time as he's always done to date. The money he's asking for he plans to use to buy chemical fertilizers with which to fertilize his land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Doña Melania C. mujer trabajadora, tiene una panadería  que junto con su esposo lograron poner hace muchos años el cual distribuyen a las diferentes  panaderías de la capital de Managua. La señora Melania tiene 44 años, procreo cuatro hijos dos trabajan y dos estudian, cuando inicio comenzó con venta de la Avon vendiendo ambulante y por encargo con los catálogos. Las dificultades es que algunos clientes no le pagaban y se descapitalizaba, es por eso comienza con su esposo a trabajar e invertir todo en la panaderia.  Con este préstamo comprara saco de harina para hacer el pan y que no le falte inventario a demás azúcar, manteca, canela, queso entre otros. Con el fin de incrementar las ventas y variedad del productos. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de apoyar al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melania C., a hard-working woman, has a bakery which she was able to open many years ago with her husband. From here they distribute to the various bakeries in the capital Managua. Melania is 44 years old and is the mother of four children, two of them are working and two are students. When she started she sold Avon as a street vendor and by mail order through catalogs. The trouble was that some clients wouldn’t pay her and she would loose capital. That is why she is starting, with her husband, to work and invest everything in the bakery. With this loan she will purchase sacks of flour for baking bread so as not to lack inventory, and also sugar, lard, cinnamon, cheese, and more. The goal is to increase sales and the variety of products. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the opportunity to support the small business person.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, cheese, cinnamon, sugar for baking more bread

loans.name: Eupemia

texts.en:
Eupemia P. is from the village of Corrales in Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Eupemia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Eupemia buys and sells fish in the market. Eupemia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Eupemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eupemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to buy fish to sell. Eupemia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. This will be Eupemia's 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon Y. (pictured here), 46, and her husband, Mr. Ing Bin, 49, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. The couple are farmers.

Pon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to use on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is married and the mother of four children who are all currently in school. The 45-year-old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Vivian is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Vivian has been in business for 18 years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en: Mahran is a 30-year-old man who lives in Ramallah. He is married and supports his wife and young children. He has owned a successful store where he sells shoes since 2001. He needs a loan of $2,500 to increase the stock in his store. This business is special because it occurs in the center of Ramallah city. Mahran is a hard working, motivated man who is seeking help to continue working on his successful business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in his store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos; William (22) y Ronald (20), en una populosa zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde que era muy joven aprendió el arte del tejido a mano con lana e hilo de diferentes colores. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos siempre trabajó tejiendo, en la actualidad son ellos quienes trabajan y cubren los gastos del hogar, pero Margarita sigue tejiendo porque es un  pasatiempo y porque no puede dejarlo, pues ama esta actividad. Como ya tiene clientes regulares, constantemente le hace pedidos de colchas, mantas, chompas, etc., las cuales  teje con mucha creatividad y le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pues compra la lana al por mayor y teje bastante rápido. Esta trabajadora mujer, los fines de semana no descansa, por lo contrario se dedica a vender ceviche (platillo típico a base de pescado) y picarones (postre), en una mesita que acondiciona fuera de su casa y le va muy bien porque se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Para el futuro quiere tener un pequeño puesto de venta de comida más estable en el mercado de su localidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le ayudará a seguir progresando. Margarita tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de varias madejas de lana al por mayor, ya que tiene varios pedidos de colchas por elaborar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children: William (22) and Ronald (20), in a populated area in the mountains of Peru. From the time when she was very young she learned the art of hand knitting with wool and weaving different colored thread. To support her children she has always worked by knitting, and currently they are the ones that work and cover the expenses of the home. However, Margarita keeps knitting because it is her pastime and she can't stop doing the activity she loves so much. Since she already has regular customers, she constantly gets orders for covers, blankets, sweaters, etc. which she knits with a lot of creativity and that generate financial gain since she purchases wool in bulk and knits very quickly. This working woman does not rest during the weekend; on the contrary, she is devoted to selling ceviche (typical dish made of fish) and picarones (a dessert) in a small table that she sets outside her home. She does well because she puts in a lot of effort to succeed. In the future she wants a small stand to become a stable supplier of food in a market nearby. This is the 1st loan she has with MFP and she is very grateful with everyone that makes it possible for her to have access to the loan that will allow her to keep making progress. Margarita wants to invest the money to purchase wool in bulk, since she has several orders to make blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in bulk

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are small-scale entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They named their group 'Sorry For We'. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,400,000 from Kiva Lenders in order to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Thirty-six-year-old Adamsay K. is the leader of this group. Adamsay (pictured on the left) was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has 2 children – one in class 2 and the other in class 5. For more than 6 years now, Adamsay has been selling cottons, lace, slippers, etc. With her share of this loan, Adamsay will buy lace, cottons, poplin, slippers and so on.

loans.use: Buy lace, cottons, poplin, slippers and so on to expand her business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 62 años, es casada, de los cuales tenía cinco hijos, el mayor falleció y los cuatro restantes son independientes y tienen familia. Por lo que vive con su esposo y su nieta en su casa, ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Lima. Desde hace quince años, que se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, por lo que cuenta con un horno parrillero pequeño a carbón, una mesa pequeña y sillas. Sin embargo muchas veces se enferma, puesto que se expone a las bajas temperaturas, por estar vendiendo a la intemperie, durante las noches que trabaja. Su actividad empieza en la mañana, en donde va al mercado a comprar los insumos necesarios para sazonar previamente los anticuchos y a las 5.00 de la tarde empieza a freírlos, en donde empieza conjuntamente la venta, hasta pasada las 11 de la noche, esperando se acabe toda la comida. Rosalía está feliz con lo que hace, puesto que las ganancias que obtiene las comparte con su esposo, siendo chofer no le da abastos para mantener su hogar, ya que su anhelo es mejorar su casa. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, asimismo desea participar de las reuniones de su grupo comunal, e integrarse a ella. Con el crédito que solicita, se comprará mesas y sillas, para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 62-year-old married woman. She had five children, but the eldest passed away. The remaining four are now independent and have their own families. She lives with her husband and granddaughter in their house, which is located in South Lima. She has been selling anticuchos (Peruvian beef skewers) in front of her house for 15 years. She has a small charcoal grill, a small table, and some chairs. However, she often gets sick since she is exposed to low temperatures as a result of her working outside at night. She starts work in the morning, when she goes to the market to buy the ingredients she needs to season and marinate the meat. Then at 5:00 pm, she starts to fry the kabobs and sells them until 11:00 pm, hoping that she will sell all the food that she has prepared.

Rosalía is satisfied with what she does because she shares her profits with her husband, who does not earn enough money to support the household because he is a driver. Their greatest wish is to improve their home. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time and participating in the group meetings. With this loan that she is now requesting, she will purchase tables and chairs to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs to expand her food stand

loans.name: María Deysi

texts.es: María Deysi Marilú B. de 43 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, una hermosa ciudad ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales los tres menores se dedican a estudiar y el mayor a trabajar.  María posee un comedor, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde desde hace muchos años ella se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto en las mañana como en los mediodías. Debido a que cuenta con muchos años de poseer su negocio cuenta con muchos clientes, razón por la que la cocina que tiene no le da a bastos para elaborar la comida necesaria para atender a sus clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar otra cocina, la cual le facilite cocinar diferentes tipo de comida, y así atender a más personas. Así mismo desea poder comprar verduras, granos básicos, bebidas para contar con más materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. María es una persona muy trabajadora  quien desea poder mejorar la economía de su familia y por esta razón desea mejorarlo.
texts.en:
María Deysi Marilú B., age 43, lives in Santa Tecla. It is a beautiful city located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and their four children. The three youngest go to school, and the oldest works. María has a restaurant, which is located in her house. She has been selling food for many years. She sells in the mornings and at midday. Because she has had her business for many years, she has a lot of customers. That is why the stove that she has is not sufficient to make all of the food she needs to take care of her customers. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. With the loan she will have enough money to buy another stove. That will facilitate her cooking different types of food, and she will be able to take care of more people. She also wants to be able to buy vegetables, basic grains, and drinks in order to have more raw material to make the food. María is a hard-working person who wants to be able to improve the family’s economy. That is the reason she wants to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stove and raw material to make food

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive sola en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la crianza y comercalización de animales menores para obtener los recursos que necesita para mantenerse. Ella cría aves de corral en unos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece a venta a los negociantes de la zona que a su vez los revenden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Esta actividad le permite también sentirse activa, a pesar de que vive sola, las viviendas cercanas son habitadas por sus familiares, entre ellos se apoyan mutuamente. Precisamente sus familiares le están animando a ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunas aves pequeñas y de alimento balanceado para su correcto desarrollo, de modo que ella pueda percibir mas ganancias y salir adelante poco a poco, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Albertina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, ella gusta mucho de sentirse útil y ayudar a los demas; en la comunidad donde vive sus conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda de material rústico, ya que las pasadas lluvias han hecho algunos daños en su estructura.
texts.en:
Albertina is 45 years old and single. She lives alone in the small community of Lagunas, a rural area in the district of Mórrope, in Lambayeque province. The area is located one hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years she has made a living raising and selling small animals, which has given her the means that she needs to live. She raises poultry in some pens that are situated behind her home. When the birds have grown to a good size she sells them to businesspeople in the area; they in turn resell the birds at the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. This activity also allows Albertina to stay active, since she lives alone, though her closest neighbors are her relatives, and all of them support each other. Her relatives are encouraging her to expand her business by purchasing some small birds and balanced feed so that they can grow properly; that way she will be able to earn more profits and get ahead little by little. That is the reason why Albertina is asking for her first loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa—a loan of 1000 soles that will help her to achieve her goal. Albertina is a hard-working woman who really likes to feel useful and to help others; in the community where she lives she is known to be an easygoing and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to make some more improvements to her home using basic materials, since the recent rains have caused structural damage to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small birds and balanced feed for expanding her business of raising and selling poultry.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 30 years old, and a rice farmer. She lives with her husband who is shown in the photo above. He works as a laborer in the construction field. The family has given birth to a young kid who goes to school. Her husband complains that he faces difficulty traveling to work because his motorcycle breaks often. She is applying for a $150 loan from Kiva in order to repair the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

S. is a farmer and grows rice for an income of about USD $1 per day. Her husband raises ducks for eggs to sell, earning an income of USD $14 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase more ducks to raise for eggs. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair the house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise for eggs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more goods such as sugar, milk, tea, coffee, biscuits, and bags of flour to sell.

loans.name: Sonadores Con Proposito 1 Group

texts.en:
Flora is the coordinator of her group, Sonadoras con Proposito (Dreamers by Purpose), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Flora’s group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and two children.

Flora is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells used clothes. She will use the profits to build her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Tuafale

texts.en:
Tuafale I. is 42 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community.  Tuafale has one year of experience in this business.  Tuafale needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan tala to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2010, Tuafale joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tuafale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su vivienda donde vende comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, gaseosas. Ella y su esposo tienen 2 hijos, pues trabaja los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Cierta cantidad de clientes vistan su tienda y el negocio se anima durante todos los días. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para en comprar más mercadería como arroz, fideos, huevos, leche, jugos, golosinas entre otras cosas. Maria es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 38. She has had a general store for more than 4 years. The majority of her customers go to her home where she sells food items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, and pop. She and her husband have 2 children. She works 7 days a week, from 5 am to 7 pm. A certain number of customers go to her store and brighten up the business every day. Maria would like to use the money from this loan to purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, eggs, milk, juice, and candies among other items. Maria is an enterprising, responsible and punctual woman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, S. Victoire est mariée à FANOU Faustin, un agent de police. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Victoire vit depuis dix huit ans à Womey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec sa famille. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Victoire n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis huit ans, Victoire  mène comme activité la vente de liqueurs et divers produits (lait, sucre, bougies, conserves de sardine, savons, boîtes d'allumettes, etc.) dans sa boutique située dans son quartier. Victoire achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Adja au Mono. Victoire a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. Dans le but d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Cotonou, in the economic capital of Benin, Victoire S. is married to Faustin Fanou, a police officer. The spouses have four children in their care, three of whom are their own and all of whom go to school. For eight years, Victoire and her family have been living in Womey in the community of Abomey Clavi. The spouses jointly provide for different family needs. Victoire did not attend school. For the past eight years, her business activity has been selling liqueurs and various products (milk, sugar, candles, canned sardines, soap, matchboxes etc) in her own store located in her neighborhood. Victoire stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin, and also in Adja in Mono [a region of Benin]. Victoire already had obtained ALIDé loans twice in the past, and repaid them well. In order to expand her activity and better respond to customer demand, Victoire is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 5 boxes of soap, 8 cases of liqueur

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
This is Bibiana D., 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus D., a farmer, and is the mother of four children, two of whom are already finished with school while the other two are currently enrolled. By the grace of God, Bibiana has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her two youngest children to college, a dream of most Filipino parents like Bibiana, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can leave to their children.

Bibiana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store retailing groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Bibiana is requesting a Php18,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Bibiana dreams of renovating her house someday soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Merlabel

texts.en: Merlabel C. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old and is married with six school-aged children. Merlabel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merlabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Merlabel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia  se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de barrotes en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ella necesita implementar sus productos, La socia comprara al por mayor arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the community bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", which is located in the district of Calca in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Carmen is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She works buying and selling necessities in the market in Calca.  She will buy rice, oil, sugar, and other products wholesale and then sell them.  She is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of more basic products.

She is thankful for and values the loan given and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products

loans.name: Irma Nellys

texts.es: Irma Nellys tiene 55 años. Se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales, no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con créditos. Hace ya 20 años que viene dedicándose a esta actividad, oficio que le ayudó a pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos todos los días sale a compra al mercado sus frutas frescas para realizar una buena elaboración de sus refrescos, por lo que espera surtir más su negocio para obtener más clientes. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con Fundación  por lo que necesita este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Irma Nellys is 55 years old and she works selling natural juices.  This is not her first experience with loans.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and it is a trade that helped her to pay for her childrens’ college expenses.  She goes out to the market every day to buy fresh fruits so that she makes good juices.  This is why she hopes to stock her store more to get more customers.  This is her sixth loan through the foundation and she needs it to buy raw material.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, 37, is married and a mother of two. She is a hardworking lady who runs a general store.  Besides that she also operates a hardware shop.  She has been running the business for three years and has managed to employ two people.  She hopes to open more outlets for her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy foodstuffs to sell in her store, and nails and cardboard to sell in the hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, nails and cardboard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese, cream and curd

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Sem P. and her young daughter. Sem P. is a humble mother who has four children and all of them are single. One of her children is employed as a worker at the garment industry. Since 1980, she has been cultivating rice on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also works with her on the farm. Beside the current farming work, Sem P. buy animals, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the animal selling business is the main source of income for this family, Sem P. requested a loan as capital to buy additional pigs and buffalo to sell, and the rest of loan will use to buy more rice to stock during  it's lowest price. Then, she will sell it later when the price increases.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and to buy rice supplies to sell when it's price increases.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel Q. T. tiene 40 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Segundo Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel Q. T., 40, is married living with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  He has six children.

The “SEÑOR DE LA SALUD” (Lord of Health) communal bank is located in Soloma which is part of Echeandia canton.  Its members are short cycle corn, rice and passion fruit farmers.  They have been in this occupation for a long time.

Segundo Manuel is a corn, rice and passion fruit farmer.  He buys is products in Comercial Viscarra and sells them in Comercial Escudero.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and passion fruit crops.  Support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a lot.

He enjoys dancing.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth Q., de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nelson (48)  y sus dos jóvenes hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Todos los días Ruth abre su tienda  desde las 5 de la mañana y comienza a vender sus variados productos, su negocio es muy concurrido en el poblado de Kimbiri, ya que es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprar más de lo habitual. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, así aprovecha para distraerse un poco, ya lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda en espera de clientes, sin poder salir muy seguido. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para adquirir más mercadería donde pueda brindar a sus clientes variados tipos de productos.Este es el sexto préstamo de Ruth con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, y en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su negocio, y de esta manera espera ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ruth Q., 38, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in a house that she owns with her husband, Nelson (48), and their two young children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Ruth opens the store, in the little town of Kimbiri, every day at 5:00am to sell her merchandise.  Business is brisk because she is a very persuasive saleswoman and often convinces her customers to buy more than they came in for.  What she most enjoys about the business is talking to her customers, something that she makes the most of to entertain them a bit.  Ruth has operated the business for 7 years and she thinks the most difficult thing about it is having to always be in the store, waiting for customers, without being able to go out for long.  In the future, she hopes to save enough money to buy more merchandise so that she can provide her customers with a wider range of merchandise.  This is Ruth's sixth MFP loan and she understands that she has to repay the loan in the agreed-upon increments.  She is a popular member of her community bank.  She will use the one-thousand new soles loan to buy products to stock her business so that she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock grocery business.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 33 years old and a member of Kiserian Mugumo group.  She sells fruits, vegetables, and cereals in Kiserian open-air market.  She has been in the business for ten years.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she is able to save her money.  She has previously serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kes to buy fruits, vegetables and cereals such as rice.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and cereals such as rice for resale

loans.name: Dalmas

texts.en: Dalmas is 32 years old, married, has three children and makes a living selling fish. He has been in business for 10 years, has four employees, and reports that his business peaks daily in the morning.  He supplements his income by renting out houses, and has felt very financially empowered since joining Faulu Kenya, which has helped him grow his business. His goal is to continue expanding his small company, and he is applying for this loan for 80,000 Kes to buy more fish to sell to his customers

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to his customers

loans.name: Ekua Grace

texts.en:
Ekua Grace O. cooks rice, beans and fried plantains for sale at Akaa krom near Abura. Ekua has received a senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a cleaner. Ekua has been cooking food for sale for four years. Her income is added to that of her husband to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more food items to cook to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more food items to cook to expand her business

loans.name: Orpa

texts.en:
Orpa is a 39-year-old lady who lives in Bolok village – which is situated about 11 km from Kupang City. Orpha is married and blessed with 4 children, named:
• Sisilia M., 19 years old, in the second semester of university
• Yoseph Fernando, 13 years old, in the second grade of junior high school
• Excelino and Valentino, 4 years old - twins

Orpa has a poultry business. She runs this business to help her husband, Blasius, to generate more income for their family. Orpha and family can not rely on Blasius’ income as a laborer because his income is insufficient to meet their daily needs and the education needs of the children.

Orpha recognizes that now her family's needs are improving since her daughter, Sisilia, is in the university. As parents, Orpha and her husband are responsible for their children’s future. Nevertheless, Orpha is grateful for the business, and she is encouraged to go ahead. 

Currently, Orpha is breeding 200 chicks; it takes 40 days to sell them at the market. Orpha has been considering adding more chicks to generate more income. Orpha wishes to get a business loan from TLM. She is requesting a loan amounting to 4,500,000 IDR. She plans to purchase more chicks and to renovate the coop. She is expecting that the loan application will be approved. She believes that the loan will have a good impact on her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Margaret has a business selling used shoes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

Margaret has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes. The main business challenges for Margaret include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goal and hope for her business is to start importing used shoes. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Kiprotich

texts.en:
Kiprotich L. is a father of three aged between one and five years old. He is a farmer in Litein town, South Rift Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for ten years producing and selling milk and vegetables in the local market. Kiprotich earns additional income from his teaching job at a local secondary school.

Kiprotich mentions drought and the outbreak of such diseases such as East Coast fever, a deadly tick-born disease affecting cattle, as potential threats to farming.

Kiprotich has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produced will be sold to repay the loan as well as used to provide for the family's basic needs. Kiprotich is optimistic the loan will improve his family's living standards. He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its agricultural loan product.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 27 years old. She has one child who is nine months old. Her husband sells different types of foodstuffs including sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava. Vestine owns a restaurant where she sells African dishes. She has had this business since 2009. With her business, she was able to buy a piece of land. She plans to save until she can afford to buy a cow. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
Alimamy K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alimamy was born in Magburaka town 30 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has one child. Alimamy provide services such as printing, photocopying, laminating, etc. He has been managing this business for five years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Alimamy and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Alimamy will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business by buying working materials to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: to buy working materials to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Kwakwanya Group

texts.fr:
Gertrude is a 40-year-old saleswoman who lives in the seat of the Ruyigi province, located in Eastern Burundi. She sells food products such as dried fish, known locally as "ndagala", cooking salt, and other products such as laundry soap. She has had this business for the past 4 years, and she also maintains a market garden. She is married to Leonidas, who is also a salesman, and they do not have children. She takes care of two children, who are her husbands children with his first wife, who is deceased. She went to school until the 6th year of primary school.

She requested a Kiva loan in order to increase her working capital to buy large quantities of food products to resell in order to make a large profit. She hopes that her business will grow significantly, so that she can provide enough food for her family.

She is a member of the Kwakwanya solidarity group.


Translated from French by Kathy Guis


Gertrude est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite au chef lieu de la Province de Ruyigi située à l’Est du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le poisson sec communément appelé « ndagala », du sel de cuisine et d’autres comme des savons de lessive, etc depuis 4 ans et elle est en même temps cultivatrice. Elle est mariée a Leonidas lui-même commerçant mais n’ont pas d’enfant. Elle prend en charge 2 enfants de son mari qu’il a eu avec sa première épouse décédée. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantites de produits alimentaires a revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour lui permettre d’assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux. 
 
Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« Kwakwanya».

loans.use: augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantites de produits a revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married with three children. Ester is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ester is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer. In the future, Ester hopes to use the extra income for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Tomasa, habita en Chacaraseca comarca de León  es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, esta casada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta ropa, bisutería, electrodoméstico y mercadería en general.  Ella inicio a la edad de 19 años como comerciante con capital propio, ella vendía ropa y joyas de oro y plata a trabajadores de una fabrica textilera ellos fueron sus primeros clientes. Hoy en día ella vende mercadería en general ambulante sale a vender a León y Chinandega es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta el trabajo pues su mayor inspiración son sus hijos ya que por ellos es que trabaja muy duro.
Solicito el préstamo para  comprar más mercadería para vender tales como ropa, electrodomésticos, bisutería. Con esta inversión espera atraer mas clientes, ofrecer mayor productos a sus clientes, pues sus expectativas son de crecer, tener una tienda que ofrezca mercadería en General y estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives in Chacaraseca, León.  She’s the mother of two children who are 3 and 2 years of age respectively.  She’s married.  She’s a merchant selling clothes, costume jewelry, home appliances and general merchandise.  She started as a merchant at the age of 19 with her own capital.  She used to sell clothes and gold and silver jewelry to employees at a textile factory; they were her first customers.  Today, she’s a street vendor of general merchandise.  She goes out selling to León and Chinandega.  She’s an enterprising woman who enjoys her work because her greatest inspiration is her children and it’s for them that she works so hard.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise like, clothes, home appliances and costume jewelry, to sell.  With this investment she will attract more customers and have a wider variety of products in stock because her expectations are to grow, to have a store stocked with general merchandise and to study a university career.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 31 years old, married and has two children. For six years, he has been operating a retail shop. He also works as a casual labourer so as to earn more income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt more about business management and met other entrepreneurs with different business ideas. Henry hopes to open other business outlets and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open another retail shop.

loans.use: to open another retail shop.

loans.name: Livia Maria

texts.es:
Livia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos, 8 de ellos independientes.  Livia estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
La señora se dedica desde hace mucho a la venta de comidas de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas, trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace tres ciclos.  Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio.
Con  este nuevo préstamo de   S/ 600.00 nuevo soles,  la señora invertirá en la compra de insumos como papa, chuño, carne, chicharrón y otros productos más, trabaja sola  en el negocio aunque a veces le ayuda  su hija.  Su esposo es militar.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio o poner una tienda bien surtida (bodega) y dejar este negocio debido a que es muy agotador.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 56 years old, married and has 9 children, 8 of them independent.  Livia studied up to 3rd grade.

For some time now she’s been a food vendor in the main square.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she used to increase working capital.

She will use this new, 600 new sol, loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, dehydrated, freeze-dried potatoes, meat, pork skin and other products.  She works alone although her daughter helps her sometimes.  Her husband’s in the military.

Her dream is to stay in this business or install a well-stocked grocery store and leave this business because it is quite exhausting.

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and the loan from the internal account.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like potatoes, dehydrated freeze-dried potato, meat, pork skin and others.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 34 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and has children between  1 and 16 years old. For the past four years she been selling  delicious Liberian food in her community. A problem she faces is finding a selling place (shop). She started her business by selling yams and learned it from her aunt. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and meat for her business. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 57 years old and married. She has seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Azucena has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

Azucena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
L. Alcancía Comunal”L. Amistad” está conformado por 10 personas unidas y responsables L. cual está formada hace 05 meses donD. L. Sra. Amelia L. presiD.. 
L. Sra. Amelia tiene 57 años D. edad es casada con 06 hijos independientes, anteriormente Amelia trabajaba en un restaurante  como cocinera,  hace 1 años tomo L. decisión D. iniciar su propio negocio así que con L. ayuda D. su esposo y  con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo iniciar su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. frituras (salchipapas, hamburguesas, alita broster)  L. cual las venD. todos los días  en las afueras D. su vivienda, trabajo que le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar. El deseo D. Amelia es D.  instalar una bodega en su casa L. cual pueda ofrecer variedades D. productos. Con el último préstamo piensa invertir en su negocio comprando insumos como papa, pollo, aceite, etc. L. Alcancía Comunal “L. Amistad” agradece L. ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Amistad Community Bank is maD. up of ten united and responsible people. The group was formed five months ago with Sra Amelia as president.

Sra Amelia is 57 years old, married, and has six grown children. In the past she worked as a cook in a restaurant, but a year ago she decided to start her own business. Now she sells fried food (hot dogs, hamburgers etc) which she sells every day outsiD. her home. The money she earns has allowed her to help her husband with household expenses. 

She now wishes to open a grocery store in her home where she can sell a range of products. With this latest loan she is planning to buy items for the store such as potatoes, chicken, oil etc. 

The Amistad Community Bank is grateful for the support that is provided.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, and oil

loans.name: Lluvia De Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia de Amor lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ninoska Carolina  de 26 años quien es comerciante ambulante de plata y artesanías desde hace 4 años. Ella con el comprar mercadería de plata y artesanía con el fin de salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son Xiomara  de 42 años quien desde hace 20 años vede especies y plantas, y Luisa Emilia  vende plantas desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The "Lluvia de Amor" ('Rain of Love") group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  

One of them is Señora Ninoska Carolina, she is 26 years old and has been working as a street vendor selling silver and handicrafts for the last four years.  With the loan, she will buy silver and handicrafts merchandise, with the end goal of getting ahead in life.

The other members are Xiomara, aged 42, who has been selling herbs and plants for the last 20 years, and Luisa Emilia, who has been selling plants for the last 10 years.

loans.use: to buy silver and handicraft items.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 53 year old lady blessed with five children, all above the age of 18.  The client operates a boutique in the Kwa Chocha settlement in Malindi town.  She has been in this business for the past ten years now and it gives her a monthly income of about KES 30,000 with which she supports her family. 

This is her first loan term with KADET.  She intends to use the entire loan to expand the business by stocking it with ladies’ make-up, body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves as well as wigs, necklaces, bracelets, and so many other things needed in the business. 

The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from the boutique to support her family financially as well as to continue restocking and gradually expanding the business.  In future, Harriet may come to own her own well established beauty store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for her boutique.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is married and has eight children. She assists her husband in taking care of the home.
Yaa is a fishmonger at Elmina. To smoke the fish, you go to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.
Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known as a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.  
Yaa's loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke and then sell.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt,  in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife helps him with his business, his older 2 kids are in school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. 

Batbayar started his raw materials business selling things such as bottles, pots, and plastics in 2005. He goes to rural areas to collect the raw materials.  Due to the high transport cost, he needs to buy a pick-up truck.  

Batbayar is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I know exactly how to run my business and I do everything I can to support my family."   He is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT to buy a pick-up truck.

loans.use: buy a pick-up truck

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Luciana  es Viuda, tiene una  despensa; comenta que tiene muchos clientes y que la venta en la misma es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad D. clientes que fielmente acuden hasta su negocio, por lo mismo esto le genera buenos ingresos.
Comenta que sus hijos la están ayudando a salir adelante, gracias al trabajo en conjunto D. toda la familia. Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso. Ella desea poder seguir con su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y kiva.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. enlatados, lácteos, sacos D. harina, azúcar, fideos y demás para venderlos en suelto. Ella quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio ya que le ve mucho futuro.
texts.en:
Luciana is a widow.  She has a grocery store and comments that she has many customers and sales are gratifying because she has quite a few customers who regularly come to her store leading to her earning good income.

She comments that her children are helping her get ahead thanks to the joint work of the entire family.  Today, she’s become a successful micro businesswoman constantly making progress.  She wants to stay in business so is asking for help from the Fundación and from Kiva.
