She is asking for the loan to buy canned goods, dairy products, and sacks of flour, sugar, noodles and others to sell in bulk.  She wants to continue growing in her business because she sees a bright future for it.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, dairy products, sacks of flour, sugar, noodles and more.

loans.name: Gullubeyim

texts.en: Gullubeyim is 55 and married with three children. She sells milk and dairy products to the local farmers and she has been doing that for the last eight years. The income her business generates is 300 AZN. Her husband helps her to look after the cows.  She applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase an additional milkier cow and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and one cattle

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is 45 year old man who is involved in farming. He has two years of experience in this field. Nabi is married and has two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). Nabi’s brothers help him to run his farm. This is the only financial income in Nabi’s family and it brings 140 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) of profit per month. 

Now he would like to increase his income and purchase seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny is a 39-year-old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of the family, and his dream is to build a permanent house as he currently lives in a semi-permanent house. He has been growing tea for eight months, and he has two acres of land so far. He has challenges of weeds which affect the output of his tea plantation and his dream is to eliminate these weeds and to have a ten-acre tea plantation. Bonny intends to buy herbicides for controlling weeds with the loan.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for controlling weeds.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, debido a la temporada que se acerca está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de un flete de dulce de panela, también granos básicos a arroz, frijoles, café, esta decisión se debe a su deseo de seguir creciendo y generando mayores ganancias para solventar las necesidades su familia, permitiéndole tener mayor disponibilidad de dinero para cualquier emergencia.
texts.en: Due to the upcoming season, Lorenzo is requesting a loan to invest in a shipment of dulce de panela (brown sugarloaf/raw cane sugar), basic grains, rice, beans and coffee. He decided to take out a loan in order continue growing his business and generating more income to pay for his family's necessities. This would also allow him to save money for any emergencies that may come up.

loans.use: buy dulce de panela (brown sugarloaf), rice, beans and coffee.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, Genara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ovejas, ella vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ovejas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ovejas al por mayor.

   La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank "SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO"; The bank is located in the district of Cachimayo, part of the province of Anta and administrative division of Cusco.

The borrower is Mauricia: She is 40 years old. She is married and has 4 children. The borrower alternates her daily activities with the business of selling sheep. She sells in various trade fairs that exist in the district of Anta. The borrower works from 8:00am until 7:00pm. The dream of the borrower is to extend the business of selling sheep. The borrower requests this loan in order to buy sheep wholesale.

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to complying with her payments.

loans.use: to buy sheep wholesale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben owns a cellular phone store in South Florida. His services include sales of mobile devices, phone plans, calling cards and accessories. 

Ruben is a hard-working young entrepreneur with many ideas for continuously improving sales. In very little time he has built a strong business and has come up with innovative ideas for business development. He and his wife both work full-time.

This loan will be used to purchase inventory; this includes accessories and cell phones. He needs an increase in inventory because promotions are increasing demand of products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory, including mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Mahmadjon

texts.ru: Благодаря Вам Махмадчон сейчас имеет постоянный бизнес. Он данный момент продвигает свой бизнес, и успешно погасил редыдущий кредит. Махмадчон серьезный и шустрый человек. Он уверен в себе, что сможет расширить свой бизнес. Но для расширения бизнеса ему нужно финансовая поддержка. Махмадчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы перевозить продукт питания и расширить бизнес. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Thanks to your support, Mahmadjon now has a stable business.  At the moment he is still developing his activity, after having successfully repaid his previous loan.  Mahmadjon is a serious and intelligent man who is confident that he will be able to grow his business.  However, in order to further expand his business, he needs some financial support.  He is taking a loan to bring in more food products and increase his activity.  He relies on you and your support.

loans.use: Для перевоза продукт питания и расширения бизнеса.

loans.name: Alba Zulema

texts.en:
My name is Alba V. and I make and sell snacks such as tortillas with quesillo, bread with beans, pancakes, baleadas(traditional honduran taco), enchiladas, tacos, emparedados, tortas, fried plantains, chilaquiles, sliced banana, soups, lunches and breakfasts. I have had my business for 5 years and I have many customers as my business is located near a bus station. My business creates an income to support my family, and my goal is to expand my inventory so that I can have better production and with the earnings I can remodel my business and educate my two children.

Mi nombre es Alba V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de golosinas como ser tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, panqueques, baleadas, enchiladas, tacos, emparedados, tortas, platanos fritos, chilaquiles, tajaditas de platano, sopas, almuerzos y desayunos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y darles un buen estudio a mis dos hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase beef, chicken, pork, vegetables, salt, water, oil, lard, sodas, disposible plates and cups, tortillas, beans, rice, bread, coffee, sugar, confectionaries, juices, butter, quesillo(traditional white cheese), cheese, milk, kitchen utensils.

Compra de carne de res, pollo, cerdo, vegetales, sal, agua, aceite, manteca, refrescos, platos y vasos desechables, tortillas, frijoles, arroz, pan, cafe, azucar, confites, jugos, mantequilla, quesillo, queso, leche, utencilios de cocina.

loans.name: Siuta

texts.en: Unlike many people in town, Siuta of Vaitele does not need to go to the market for root crops or local produce.  She owns her own plantation and also has a BBQ stand.  At the stand, she sells both BBQ and fruits that she has grown on the plantation.  Additionally her husband sells his catch at the fish market.  When all her expenses are paid for, she saves half of her $150. The other half is spent on her children and family.  Her husbands earnings are separate from hers and all of it is deposited in the bank for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a BBQ stove, mutton flap, chicken, turkey tails, cement and timber.

loans.name: Elsa Eva

texts.en:
Elsa is married and has two sons aged 16 and 19. Her husband Jose Luis works for a transportation company but his salary is insufficient to meet all their children's expenses. They are in preparatory school and one is about to graduate and begin college. Faced with the major expense of giving her sons a good education, Elsa has begun selling cosmetics. Fortunately, her business is going well and her sales are increasing. At this time Elsa needs a loan for $250 to buy a greater variety of merchandise and fill orders. She promises to repay the loan within 3-6 months. Elsa and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 16 y 19 años de edad, José Luís, su esposo, labora en una empresa de transportes, pero su salario no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus hijos, ahora ellos están estudiando la preparatoria y uno de ellos está a punto de terminar e iniciar sus estudios universitarios, los cuales resultan más costosos, ante esta necesidad, Elsa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos para poder ayudar a que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y se han incrementado sus ventas.

En estos momentos Elsa requiere de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y también surtir pedidos que ya tiene, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Elsa quiere que su negocio pueda desarrollarse exitosamente, y tú puedes contribuir a esto y a que sus hijos puedan concluir sus estudios, Elsa y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is 41 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband does not have regular work and has left for Russia to earn money. Gulnora and her daughter make a living sewing national Tajik dresses and selling them in the markets. To make and sell the dresses, Gunora has rented a place in the market , where her daughter always helps her. As demand for dresses is high this season, Gulnora travels 80km to buy fabric from the wholesale market.

She recently received a loan from Microinvest which she used to purchase fabric. This increased quantity of ready dresses brought her business additional profit. Therefore, she is now requesting a second loan to purchase more fabric to meet growing demand.

[You can see Gulnora's daughter, who helps her with her sewing business, in the photo]

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is a 43 year old married mother of six (6) children, and sells all kinds of food items in the village market. According to her the loan of US$475 will enhance her business and also reach out to more customers that will come and buy from her. She has been in this business since 1992. She resides in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more food items such as garri and plantain for sale

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro Francisco is a man who struggles to take care of his wife and his little daughter who is only 2 years old and who needs a prosperous future. Everything started 4 years ago, when Pedro was let go from his job. Pedro was desperate because he couldn’t find a job – but he began to see a way in which he could take care of himself and his wife. After thinking a long time about a suitable business, he heard that in Leon, Guanajuato, they sell inexpensive, but good quality shoes. So with the little money that he had left from when he was let go, he embarked upon a new venture and bought shoes to sell outside of his neighborhood.

It was in this manner that little by little he established himself and today he has a daughter for whom he constantly struggles to get ahead. Because of the change of the seasons, Pedro is asking for a loan of $375 that he will pay back over a term of 6 months. With this money he is able to stock up for the Christmas season. The ability to help Pedro is in your hands, so that he can buy a small gift for his daughter that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro Francisco, es un hombre que lucha por sacar adelante a su esposa y a su pequeña jiha de tansolo dos años, quien necesita de un fururo próspero. Todo comenzó hace cuatro años, cuando despiden a Pedro, y desesperado porque no encontraba trabajo comenzó a ver la manera en que él pudiera sacar adelate a el y a su esposa, después de pensar un largo tiempo en el negocio idóneo, le comentan que en León Guanajuato venden zapatos de buena calidad y económicos, y se lanzó con el poco dinero que le había quedado de su despido. Y compró zapatos para vender fuera de su colonia.

Así poco a poco fue estableciendose. Y hoy tiene una hija por quien lucha constantemente para salir adelante. Debido a que es cambio de temporada Pedro está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dienro poder surtir para la época navideña. En tus manos está en ayudarle paraque Pedro pueda comprarle un pequeño regalo a su hija que tanto quiere.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula L. is a woman who, in spite of all the trials that life has given her, has been able to succeed. Ten years ago she separated from her husband, "In those days I worked washing and ironing other people's clothes, but I suffered an accident that left me immobilized in the arms, " Paula commented. However, this problem did not make her fall since she had to move forward for her hour children, so that they wouldn't suffer for the loss of a father figure and did not stop studying. This is why Paula started looking for a way to make money in a way that did not require her to move her arms so much. And so it was that she started selling used clothes among her neighbors, family, and friends. Little by little she acquired more customers who would ask her for new things, and so it was that she started buying new clothes and shoes to be able to have variety to offer to her customers.

Right now, her youngest daughter who is 25, is the only one living with her, and on some occasions she helps out in the store since she has a humble job. Her other children are married and have other expenses so they cannot help Paula with her expenses. This is why Paula keeps working hard so that her business can succeed and so she doesn't have to depend totally on her children. Paula is requesting a loan for US $375 to be paid in a period of 4 months. With this money Paula will be able to buy more merchandise for the end of the year in which a lot of people like wearing new clothes to celebrate With your help, Paula will be able to grow her business and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Paula L. es una mujer que a pesar de todos los retos que la vida le a puesto a sabido superarlos. Hace diez años se separó de su esposo “En ese tiempo yo me dedicaba a lavar y a planchar ropa ajena pero sufrí un accidente que me dejo inmovilidad en los brazos” comentó Paula. Sin embargo este problema no la dejó caer puesto que tenía que salir adelante por sus cuatros hijos para que ellos no resintieran la pérdida de una figura paterna y que no dejaran de estudiar. Fue así como Paula comenzó a buscar una manera de obtener dinero pero que no requiriera mover tanto los brazos. Y fue así como comenzó a vender ropa usada entre sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más clientes que cada vez le iban pidiendo cosas nuevas, y fue así que comenzó a comprar ropa nueva y calzado para poder tener variedad qué ofrecerle a sus clientes.

Actualmente la hija más chica, de 25 años es la única que vive con ella y en ocasiones la ayuda en la tienda, puesto que ella ya tiene un trabajo modesto. Y sus otros hijos ya están casado y tienen otros gastos por eso no pueden ayudarla con todos los gastos que ella tiene. Es por eso que Paula continua trabajando y luchando por que su negocio salga adelante, y así no tener que depender totalmente de sus hijos. Paula está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Paula podrá comprar más mercancía para la este fin de año que muchas personas les gusta estrenar en esta celebración. Con tu ayuda Paula podrá crecer su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying new merchandise to stock her business (Comprar mercancía nueva para surtir su negocio)

loans.name: Ayubu's Group

texts.en: Ayubu G., Mrisho H.,, Saidi M., Hasumani M., Paulo J. and Salehe S., are, are six members of the Mwanzo group. They have been with Youth self employment foundation for the past five months. They carry out their businesses in Vingunguti area(most known for butchery activities, mainly goats)  , a Dar Es Salaam suburb and at least almost all have been in business for the past five years. Their businesses run from butchery, restaurants and kiosks. They are jointly in need of USD 2400, in which each is top take USD 400, to help them expand their business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Abduvoris

texts.en:
G. Abduvoris is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children. 

Abduvoris sells confectionery like candies, cookies, pastries, fruit jelly. He is in this business for about 13 years. Abduvoris supplies the goods from the neighboring city two times a month. He has been working with IMON for more than 5 years and has a positive credit history. The generated income allows Abduvoris to support his large family. He is also dreaming of educating all of his children in good schools.

Today Abduvoris requests 1 000.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. He is going to spend the loan to purchase confectionery  so he can enlarge the range of goods. The income  generated from this he is planning to spend on buying a private store and for supporting of his family and educating his children. Abduvoris thanks all for the support.

loans.use: Enlarging the range of goods and for the generated income purchasing of the private store

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Cao Thi S., 47 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund for five years. As a hard-working woman, although holding two jobs, Mrs. S. still discussed with her husband to borrow money to start selling chicken in the village market. With her skills and passion, Mrs. S. easily got used to her new job. Her family income increases significantly. This time she plans to borrow 400USD to buy more chickens, which are then sold to wedding or funeral. Her family monthly income is now 250USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị S., 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đến nay là năm thứ 5. Bản chất là người phụ nữ năng động chịu thương chịu khó, mặc dù gia đình đã có nghề phụ nhưng thời gian nhàn rỗi vẫn còn nhiều, chị đã bàn với chồng vay vốn để buôn bán gà tại chợ địa phuơng. Với bản tính khéo léo, thật thà, nhanh nhẹn nên chị S. thích nghi nhanh chóng với việc buôn bán. Kinh tế gia đình chị đi lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 400USD để thêm vốn đầu tư vào hàng gà phục vụ cho đám hỷ, hiếu vv... Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. decided to have an activity that would generate her an income but that would allow her to take care of her two children. It was then that she decided to sell shoes through catalogues and she is currently doing very well because she has increased her clientele.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 3 months, to buy merchandise and supply pending orders. With your help Rosa will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa González decidía a tener una actividad que le generara ingresos pero que le permitiera seguir al tanto de sus 2 hijos, fue que inicio en la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y actualmente le va muy bien ya que ha incrementado su cartera de clientes.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina Ganoso is married and has two school age sons.

She owns a restaurant located next to the river. Her husband is a fisher who owns a boat with a motor. He sells fish and provides his wife with fish to prepare dishes to offer in her restaurant.

Joaquina’s husband used to have a net, but somebody stole it. That is why they need the credit, to buy a new net to continue fishing.

loans.use: Purchase of a net

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario has a car that he uses to transport people from the airport to the center of the city of La Paz. His wife is a businesswoman who sells hamburgers. This is the seventh time that he is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used for the conversion of his vehicle from gasoline to gas thereby increasing his income by reducing the amount spent on gasoline. He is a responsible client in making his payments and his objective in the future is to be able to buy another car that will generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene una movilidad que trabaja en el servicio de transporte del aeropuerto al centro de la ciudad de la Paz, su esposa es comerciante que vende hamburguesas. Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la conversión de gasolina a gas y así mejorar sus ingresos reduciendo sus gastos de gasolina. Es un cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, y su objetivo en el futuro es poder comprarse otra movilidad que le pueda generar mas ingresos.

loans.use: Convert the car used in transportation business from gasoline to gas

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28975&_tpos=9&_tpg=1

Alejandra D. L. C. P. is partner in the village bank “Llamkasum” (Quechua for “We work in Quechua”.)

Alejandra is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. Alejandra sells peas, beans and sweet potato from a stall at the Nery García market from dawn, all day long, every day of the week and plants potatoes and wheat in their district HuamanguilL. which she then sells in the same market.

Alejandra needs a loan of 1500 soles, which would be invested to buy peas, beans and sweet potatoes.

Alejandra’s dream is to expand her business and that her children grow up to be professionally trained.

loans.use: Buy peas, beans and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi A. is 43 years old and married.  She and Mr. A. have four children.  Bummi sells drinks in retail to her customers.  She has been in this business for the past four years.  She needs a loan of $600 to buy directly from the company instead of buying from resellers.  She said that this will reduce costs and increase profit, which will go a long way in helping to meet her family’s needs.  She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO (Kiva’s Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi M. sells foodstuffs and cooked foods. She cooks foods like eba, amala and fufu. She has been in this business for a long time. M. is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Iran, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She is requesting the loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

texts.fr:
Madame A. Achiomé est née  le 16 novembre 1969 à Sokodé dans la région  centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Son mari est un électricien bâtiment et a un revenu irrégulier.  Elle a pour activité la vente des articles scolaires dans le quartier d’Agoè, activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2003 lui procure beaucoup de revenu surtout à l’approche des rentrées scolaires.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra  d’acheter 25 cartons de cahiers, 33 paquets de couvertures et 40 boites de bics. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Achiomé A. was born on November 16, 1969 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married and has three (3) children. Her husband is an electrician in the construction industry and has sporadic income. She sells school supplies in the Agoè quarter. This job, which she started in 2003, has supplied her with a substantial income especially during the beginning of the school year.

This loan that she is requesting, which is her second, will allow her to purchase 25 boxes of notebooks, 33 packs of book covers, and 40 boxes of pens. With the income she earns from her job she will be able to help her husband manage the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru:
Садиева Мехринисо, 1973 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов и овощей. У нее 15 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Дехконбозор» Гисарского района фруктами, овощами,  а в сезон продает рыбу, жаренную и сырую. У Мехринисо много постоянных клиентов, часто ее рыбу закупают оптом в столовые и пивные бары. Хосият хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар у дехкан, рыбаков  и поставщиков из Худжанда.
Хосият хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 1500 сомони чтоб закупить рыбы.
texts.en:
Mehriniso S. was born in 1973, she is married and has two children. She started her own business selling fruits and vegetables. She has fifteen years experience in this business. She sells on the Dehkonbozor market of the Gissar region things such as fruits, vegetables, and fried or raw fish when it's the season. Merhiniso has many regular customers who often buy her fish in wholesale for eateries and beer pubs. Merhiniso wants to increase her goods circulation and make more profits. She buys the goods from fisherman and suppliers from Hudjand. She wants to get a loan with the help of Kiva for 1500 somoni (USD$450) to buy fish.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Kloa

texts.en:
Kloa S., 61, lives with her husband and one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband grow rice twice a year, during the rainy and dry seasons, typically earning about $3 each day. Besides farming, Kloa also has a business weaving cotton scarves at home to earn an additional $3 each day.

Kloa S. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 58 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos José de 14 años y Asunción de 13. Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, actividad que viene realizando desde hace ya 12 años para mantener a su familia, la cual es su mayor incentivo, para salir adelante. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo son las ganancias que obtiene de la venta, ya que esto le permite brindarle educación, alimento y los demás gastos que requieren sus pequeños. A Rosa no le resulta difícil su trabajo, pero si muy agotador, debido a que debe permanecer durante varias horas ofreciendo su producto. Rosa quiere salir adelante y por eso requiere de nuestro apoyo para lograr todas sus metas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 58-year-old single mother who lives with her children José 14, and Asunción, 13. She earns her living by selling beer, which she has been doing for the past 12 years to support her family, her main reason for forging ahead. What she likes about her work are the earnings she gets from her sales, as they allow her provide education, food, and everything else her little ones need. Rosa does not find her work difficult, but it is exhausting since she has to spend quite a few hours at a time selling her product. Rosa would like to get ahead, so she requires our support to achieve all of her goals. This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to purchase more cases of beer in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace P. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Grace sells fish which she buys from the fishermen and then brings them home for processing and preservation. She sends them to the market for sale at Cape Coast, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Grace plans to reinvest the new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to increase her capital and buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Huamanguina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Huamanguina  inicia su primer ciclo con  15 socias, muchas de ellas viven en el mismo barrio. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta comidas, cosméticos, golosinas, bebidas, repuestos, abarrotes en general y fabricación de ladrillos.

Sus ventas lo realizan de manera ambulatoria, reparten de casa en casa, en los mercados y también en sus viviendas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total de 7,800 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de platos, ollas, azúcar, arroz, leche, cosméticos, cebolla, zanahoria, chompas, polos y frutas variadas.

Los sueños de las socias son que sus hijos continúen sus estudios, ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Huamanguina Bank started its first cycle with 15 members, and many live in the same neighborhood. The members run a variety of businesses such as food sales, cosmetics, snacks, beverages, spare parts, groceries, and brick-making. They typically work as traveling saleswomen, selling door-to-door, at local markets, and also from their own homes. The members need different loan amounts such as 300.00 Peruvian soles, 600 soles, etc., totaling 7,800.00 Peruvian soles worth of loans to the cooperative bank. Their loan funds will be invested into the purchase of plates, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onion, carrots, sweaters, tops, and a variety of fruits. The members’ dreams including seeing their children continue with their educations, expanding and improving their businesses, and owning their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, tops, and a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Ni Komang Partini

texts.id: Biarpun sebagai istri seorang Guru, Komang Partini,sangat ulet bekerja, Partini membuka usaha kantin disekolahnya,dan juga membuka usaha warung dirumahnya.Partini ikut bergabung di Dinari masuk kelompok KWT Teratai Mekar sudah dua kali periode dan pelunasan di akhir periode. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,-, Partini menjual bermacam-macam barang dagangan, seperti jajan,nasi,buah-buahan,minuman dan lain-lain. Untuk dikantin sekolahnya Partini bergiliran dalam berdagang dengan istri-istri guru yang lain. Dalam satu bulan,Partini mendapat giliran berdagang sebanyak 1 minggu ,Partini mulai berjualan dari pagi hari sampai siang hari,selanjutnya Partini berdagang dirumahnya sampai sore hari dirumahnya Partini juga menyediakan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan,minuman,soto,lontong dan lain-lain,juga dedak,konsendrat untuk babinya disediakan dirumahnya . Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.60.000,- perbulan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya karena kedua anaknya sudah bekerja dan yang paling besar sudah menikah dan tinggal di Jawa. Rumahnya sudah diperbaiki dan sudah permanen.Dibangun sendiri ditanah mertuanya dan hidup berdekatan dengan semua keluarganya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari,usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang.
texts.en:
Although a wife of a teacher, Komang Partini is willing to work, Partini runs a canteen in her husband’s school, and also operate a stall at home. Partini participate in Dinari joining KWT Teratai Mekar twice and repaid at the end of the period. With initial loan of Rp.1.000.000,- (about USD100), Partini sells a variety of goods, like snacks, rice, fruits, drinks and others. For the school canteen operation, Partini rotates it amongst the wives of other teachers. In a month, Partini gets to operate the school canteen for a week; Partini begins selling from the morning until early afternoon, after that Partini operates her stall at home until evening. Partini also prepares a variety of food, drinks, soups, cooked rice and others; also pig’s feed is prepared in the house. Profit attained amount to Rp.60.000,- (about USD6) per month. This profit is used to subsidize the family’s expenses as her 2 children is already working; the elder already married. And living in Jawa. Her house has been renovated and is permanent, self-built on the in-laws’ property and living close to relatives. Her hope is with this loan from Dinari, her business will advance and expand.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta tiene 34 años, lleva viviendo con su pareja por más de 15 años, es madre de tres hijos, que actualmente viven en su casa. De niña no tuvo mucho tiempo para los juegos, su labor era apoyar a cultivar las chacras a sus padres, ya que eran numerosos hijos y les faltaba dinero para que puedan estudiar, ella se comprometió pensando que su situación cambiaría, pero nada de eso ocurrió. Cuando tuvo su propia familia se incrementaron sus labores, ahora se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar la comida para sus hijos, en seguida guisa el menú y horas más tarde va a la chacra con su esposo para apoyarlo en los cultivos de piñas. En aras de incrementar sus ingresos, hace 3 meses empezó a vender planta y flores para los huertos, cobrando entre 1 a 5 soles por cada una. Pero al margen de sus carencias económicas, Fausta es muy feliz con su familia, dice que cada sonrisa de sus hijos la motivan a trabajar en su chacra, aunque de joven esta labor no le gustaba. Ahora tiene muchas expectativas de trabajar con créditos, en su banco comunal, del cual tiene muchas ideas positivas, también se compromete a realizar sus pagos puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra plantas, de ese modo aumentar sus ventas, para que con el paso del tiempo pueda ir acumulando ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
Fausta is 34 years old, has been living with her partner for 15 years, and is the mother of three children, who at present live in her house. From childhood, she did not have much time for playing. Her work was to support her parents in cultivating their farms. Since there were many children, her family lacked the money for them to go to school. She committed herself to thinking that their situation would change, but this did not occur. When she had her own family, her work increased. Now she wakes up at 5:00am to make food for her children. She cooks and hours later, goes to the farm with her husband to help him cultivate pineapples. In an effort to increase her earnings, 3 months ago, she started to sell plants and flowers from the orchards, earning between 1 to 5 soles for each one. But apart from her financial struggles, Fausta is very happy with her family. She says that every day her children motivate her to work in the farm, even though from youth, she didn’t like this work. Now she has many expectations from working with the loans in her community bank, from which she has many positive ideas. She also promises to make her payments punctually. The money she requests is to buy plants and in this way to increase her sales, so that over time, she will be able to accumulate more earnings for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more plants to sell

loans.name: Bourehima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bourehima Sidibé est âgé de  57 ans et vit avec ses 15 enfants et ses deux femmes dans le quartier Dougounina de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il commença dès à son jeune âge les activités économiques. Avec une expérience de 26 ans, Monsieur Bourehima Sidibé a une maîtrise totale de son activité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires afin de satisfaire en diversifiant ses pièces détachées, Monsieur Bourehima Sidibé rejoint l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des pièces détachées pour automobiles auprès des fournisseurs qui vont à Lomé (république du Togo). Il effectue sa vente auprès des mécaniciens de la ville au comptant en détail et crédit.
Il espère gagner 30 000 FCFA par mois qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Mr. Bourehima Sidibé, age 57, lives with his 15 children and two wives in the Dougounina neighborhood in Bougouni (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Having never attended school, he started a business at an early age. Having now 26 years of experience, Mr. Bourehima Sidibé totally master his business. Looking for complementary financial resources in order to better satisfy his clients by diversifying the spare parts he sells, he joined Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is seeking its first individual loan. This loan will enable him to buy car spare parts from providers who travel to Lomé. He sells the spare parts to mechanics in the city, for cash or on credit. He hopes to turn a profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 60) each month, to be used to expand his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell spare parts

loans.name: Odina

texts.en:
A. Odina is 28 years old. He is married with two children. Odina is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair amount of experience in agriculture. Currently, Odina is very happy about his two children, who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business.

He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients: seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Since 2003, Felix A. has made car seats in Siwdo near Cape Coast. He is single with no children and has received an education through junior high school.  He is responsible for paying for utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more cushions and other materials to enhance his work. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: To buy more cushions and other materials to enhance his work

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 36-year-old married man with two children, living in Haret Horeik, Mount Lebanon. He has been a juice vendor since 2003, and he services the neighboring areas. Today, Ghassan is requesting to borrow US$ 800 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is very happy with Kiva loans. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 31 years old and married with two children. She hopes for the loan of N160,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia O. tiene la edad de 58 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, ellos ayudan a su Mama y asisten a una escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios surgen desde hace mucho tiempo y fue con la ayuda de sus padres, ellos le enseñaron este oficio para que obtuviera un medio para generar ingresos, Nubia comenzó con la elaboración de vestidos para niños, ellos fueron sus primeros clientes más tarde decide incursionar en la elaboración de pantalones, trajes y faldas y así sus clientes aumentan por la extensa variedad de productos que ofrecía. Este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como tela, agujas, alfileres, hilo y tijeras. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus confecciones y además trasmitir este conocimientos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nubia Ordóñez is 58 years old. She is married and has two children to support. They help their mother and also attend school. Nubia has been working as a seamstress for more than 40 years. She started this work a long time ago with the help of her parents who taught her how to sew so she would have a way of earning an income. At first Nubia made clothing for children so they were her first customers. Later she decided to venture into making pants, dresses, and skirts; as a result she gained more customers because of the wide variety of products she offered. Nubia will use this loan to buy items such as material, needles, pins, thread and scissors. She wants to improve the quality of the clothes she makes and also pass on her skills to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dress-making supplies

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en: Farouk is a 36-year-old married man with 2 children. He has been working as a painter since 2001 to improve living conditions for his family. Today, Farouk is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase an air compressor to expand his work.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the Semkini borrower group in kihesa Iringa,she is 21 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 2 years.

Beatrice started her own business selling Tapes and DVDs 1 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 20,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Beatrice first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested Tsh  amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more DVD.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan ,Beatrice hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more tapes and DVDs

loans.name: Hernando Eulogio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Hernando Eulogio C. le está haciendo falta la lisa de concreto en la planta alta de la casa, estos cuartos son para sus hijos que son su responsabilidad ya que está separado de su esposa. 
Esta solicitando es préstamo para realizar la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la elaboración de la losa. Ya que desea que sus hijos tenga su propio espacio en la casa.
El señor Hernando Eulogio trabaja como inspector de una escuela, este es el ingreso que el genera para darles lo mejor a su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.

loans.use: Colocación de la losa de concreto en la planta alta

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Like any mother, Merasol E. wants to provide the best things for her children; sending them to college, buying new and nice looking school clothes, classroom supplies, giving them a bigger allowance and more. But because she doesn't have all the riches, she tells her children to be contented with what they have.

Merasol is a rice grower in Veruela Agusan del Sur, in Mindanao. She has tilled a field since 1980. Merasol hopes the farm will give her enough income to support the needs of her three children.

She would like a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to meet her farming needs and pay for equipment she uses during land preparation. Receiving this loan will help her business.

loans.use: Farm equipment financing.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el centro poblado Chosica del Norte, distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene en su casa un horno en el cual elabora pan, desde hace tres años su familia se sostiene económicamente con esta actividad, su esposo solía trabajar como obrero de construcción civil, pero debido a su avanzada edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y retomar su oficio de panadero.

Gregoria trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 6 de la tarde hasta muy avanzada la noche amasando los ingredientes para la elaboración del pan, luego lo hornean en la madrugada para sacarlo a la venta. Todos los días sus dos hijos menores  salen en bicicleta a las 5.30 de la madrugada para distribuir el pan elaborado a los clientes y después de terminada esta labor van a la escuela.

Los continuos incrementos de precio de los insumos que utiliza regularmente en la elaboración de los panes (harina, manteca y leña para su horno), han hecho que lo percibido diariamente en el negocio no sea suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, por este motivo Gregoria se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles, que piensa invertir en la compra de más insumos para ampliar su negocio.

Gregoria sueña con terminar de construir su casa y con que sus dos últimos hijos puedan  estudiar alguna carrera técnica, ella es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a mother of a family, 55 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the centre of the village Chosica del Norte, district of La Victoria, located 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In her home she has an oven that she uses to make bread, which has supported her family economically for the last three years. Her husband used to work as a civil construction worker, but due to his age he had to quit his job and take up his previous profession as a baker. Gregoria works with her husband from 6 in the evening until very late in the night, mixing the ingredients to make bread and then baking early in the morning before taking it out to sell. Every day her two youngest children leave the house by bicycle at 5.30 in the morning to distribute bread to the customers and then go on to school once they have finished. The continual increase in the price of the supplies that Gregoria regularly uses to make bread (flour, butter and wood for the oven) has meant that the business' daily income is not enough to cover all the family's costs. For this reason, she has seen the need to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1100 nuevos soles, which she intends to invest in the purchase of more supplies to expand her business. Gregoria dreams of being able to finish building her house and for her two youngest children to study a technical degree. She is a hardworking, honest woman who is very loved by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make bread

location.town: Chosica del Norte - La Victoria - Chiclayo

loans.name: Gandjina

texts.en:
I. Gandjina is 28 years old. She is selling perfumery and cosmetics in the store which she rents. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Gandjina is dreaming of expanding her business, opening her own store, and establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Today she requests 5,500 somoni (TJS) in order to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics, such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, and others, with the purpose of increasing the range of her goods. Gandjina would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and cosmetics to sell, in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Ghana Star Bakery Group

texts.en: At 39 years of age, Maseray T. has already acquired 8 years of experience in her current business: selling bread from a stand in the town where she lives. She is the leader of the Ghana Star Bakery Group, which also includes Abdulai B., Alimamy B., Hawa G., and Mabinty K.. Maseray is seeking a loan to buy more flour and expand her business. She is married and her husband is a teacher. In his time off, her husband bakes the bread that Maseray sells. They have 2 children, both of whom attend primary school.  The Ghana Star Bakery Group is seeking a loan of 2.5 million LE from SMT and Kiva to increase their livelihoods.

loans.use: To buy flour to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase food for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell at retail clothing and baby outfits

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito S. is from the village of Iligan City. He is 48 years old. Charlito is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Charlito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Charlito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charlito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlito is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Charlito's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hazel's Group

texts.en:
Hazel S. is from the village of Lilo-an Bonifacio. She is 39 years old. Hazel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hazel owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as can goods like sardines, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Hazel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is married and mother of seven children who are all currently in school. The thirty-seven year old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Akosua is a trader. She trades in earthenware. She sells on a table top at the local market. She procures the wares from the manufacturers in nearby communities. Akosua sometimes also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure wares in bulk.

loans.use: To buy earthenware in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una joven madre de un niño de 12 años, tiene 30 años y está muy dedicada a su negocio. Por el momento vive con su pareja e hijo en la casa de su madre.

Desde hace 7 años tiene una bodega, la cual implementó en su actual vivienda. Todas las mañanas, a partir de las 6 Betty limpia y ordena los productos de su tienda, además de preparar los condimentos que vende molidos. Al comienzo no le gustaba moler las especias porque se maltrataban sus manos y le parecía muy difícil, pero como le es bastante rentable, ya se acostumbró a esa labor. Betty tiene el concepto de que “en su bodega no deba faltar nada y debe estar muy limpia”, por ello se esmera todo el tiempo para que su tienda tenga un buen aspecto, pues así atrajo la atención de sus vecinos. Generalmente trabaja sola, ya que su esposo se dedica al transporte en motocarro. 
Para este año, ambos se han propuesto ahorrar dinero para comprar un terreno donde puedan construir su casa propia para el bienestar de su hijo.

Este es la tercera vez que tiene crédito con MFP y sabe que si es responsable seguirá contando con posteriores préstamos que le permitirán crecer en su negocio y hacer realidad su sueño. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de productos para su bodega, para que de ese modo capte mayor clientela y sus ganancias aumenten.
texts.en:
Betty is the young mother of a 12 year old. She is 30, and she is very devoted to her business. For the moment she lives with her life partner and son in her mother’s house. She has had a convenience store for seven years. She set it up in her current house. Betty cleans and arranges the products in her store starting at six in the morning. She also prepares the condiments that she sells ground. When she started she did not like to grind the spices because it hurt her hands and it seemed very difficult. But, as it is profitable, she is now accustomed to the work. Betty has the motto, “My store needs to have everything and needs to be very clean”. That is why she works so hard all of the time for her store to look good. This attracts the neighbors’ attention. She generally works alone because her husband works in transportation with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motor vehicle). This year both of them have proposed saving money to buy a piece of land where they can build their own house for their son’s well-being. This is the third time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that if she is responsible she will continue to get loans, which will allow her business to grow and make her dream come true. The money she is now requesting is to get more products for her convenience store. That way she will get more customers and her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Clara,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  57 años de edad, nuestra socia es viuda y 4 hijos de 38, 35, 30, 28 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia  tiene una tienda abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes ella comprará mercadería y obtendrá mejores ganancias para continuar ayudando en los estudios a sus hijos en la universidad, nuestra socia tiene este negocio 10 años y con esto los ha educado a sus hijos y continua haciéndolo. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Clara, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 57 years old and a widowed with four children, ages 38, 35, 30, and 28. She alternates her activity between her household work and that of her small business, a small grocery shop. She would like to buy merchandise in order to stock her shop and improve her income in order to be able to continue helping her college aged sons pay for their education. She has had this business for 10 years and has paid for her children’s education and continues to do so. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise and stock her store. She appreciates this opportunity and promises to repay her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Felicita Ramona

texts.es:
Esta cliente es una profesora la cual esta ubicada en el Rpto Felix Pedro Carrillo y ella es originaria de la comunidad de la quimera.
Pero con sacrificio compro un lote de terreno y de acuerdo a sus posibilidades y a un prestamo que leemos otorgado a logrado venir mejorando su casa de habitacion y por ende tener un mejor nivel de vida.
Cabe mencionar que esta cliente fue alfabetisada y con tanta dedicacion a logrado coronarce como profesora de primaria pero ella sigue estudiando y lleva segundo año de licenciatura en Sicologia.
texts.en:
This client is a teacher located in Rpto Felix Pedro Carrillo, she is originally from the community of La Quimera. With much sacrifice she bought a lot suitable for her plans, and with a loan, she successfully made improvements to her home with the goal of a better standard of life. She will use this loan to purchase wood for a door, cement blocks, cement, and labor. We should mention that this client is educated, and with a lot of dedication she successfully achieved the position of primary school teacher. She is continuing her education, currently in the second year of a Sociology degree.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of home improvement supplies and labor

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora es casada, la misma es dueña de una costurería donde produce todo lo que sea refernte a costura recta, su especialidad son las confecciones de sabanas, sobrerecamas, forros para fundas, cortinados en general, trabajos en croches, etc.
 La misma posee muchos cleintes, envia sus trabajos a la argentina, paises de europa, como ser Italia, españa, portugal, etc;  situado en la ciudad de Pilar, sobre la calle Paolo Alberzoni y 1 marzo de esta ciudad. 
Ella realiza estos trabajos desde hace más de 15 años en el Ramo de la cofección. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia,  donde vive con su marido, quien es jubilado.
Para satisfacer la demanda de productos con crédito que solicitó para su pequeña empresa, adquirirá insumos como telas, forros, hilos, agujas, etc. y así mejorar sus ingresos mediante la calidad de sus productos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya, por los buenos servicios brindados a su microempresa.
texts.en:
Ms. Benitez is a married woman who owns a sewing workshop. Her specialty is making bed sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, drapery, crochet, etc. She has many customers, and she sends her work to Argentina and European countries like Italy, Spain, Portugal, etc. Her business is located in the city of Pilar, on the corner of Paolo Alberzoni and 1 Marzo Street.

She has been involved in sewing for over 15 years. She and her retired husband own their house. In order to meet customer demand, she will purchase materials like fabric, lining, thread, and needles with this loan, thus improving her income via the quality of her products.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the services it has given to her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lining, thread, curtain accessories, etc.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C. and her husband, Mr. Thy Chamroeun (pictured together), live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Their daughter attends school; the son is still young and stays at home. 

Loeng has been a silk weaver since 1993, while her husband has been a boat builder for more than twenty years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to fill-up the land of her house and to buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business, as well.

loans.use: To fill-up the land of her house and buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Miguel Jerónimo

texts.es: Miguel Jerónimo M. M. se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura actividad que aprendió en el seno familiar. El invertirá el crédito en abono, braviado, rayado y semillas para la cosecha de maíz, frijoles, yuca etc.
texts.en:
Miguel Jerónimo M. M. has worked in agriculture since he was very young. learning it from his family. He is seeking a loan to invest in fertiliser, braviado, cuttings, and seeds so he can sow maize, beans, yuca etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and seeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married lady with one son, Eric, who is now two years old.  For ten years, she has been operating a retail shop where she sells cereals and food products.  She belongs to a group called 'Five Star'.  Being a member of this group, she is able to access loans easily from Faulu Kenya because the members guarantee each other's loans.  

Eunice has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more cereals and food products for sale.  She hopes to open up a supermarket in the future.  She dreams of venturing into other businesses so as to increase her income.  Eunice says that she is determined to grow her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cereals and other food products

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas N. is from the town of Banga. He is 52 years old and married, and he has 2 school-aged children. He is involved in farming. He plants and harvests corn crops for sale. He also started raising hogs recently. He hopes for his ventures to be successful someday. Nicolas has been engaged in his business for over 45 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nicolas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nicolas is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feed for his hogs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nicolas from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 30-year-old Lebanese borrower. She has two children. Since 2004, Maha has been producing agro products, as well as homemade Lebanese bread called 'saj'. A 'saj' is the metal oven used to make 'saj' bread; it is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome. The 'saj' is used to make several types of bread, including 'markouk' (thinned) bread and doughy confections, or 'mankoucheh'. 

Maha notes that when she first started, she faced some challenges in securing financing for her business. She decided on doing her business because she says that she has good experience of the market demand and has experience in her work. Today, Maha has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans on purchasing a 'saj' machine and raw materials for her food production. She hopes to further expand and enhance her work in the future.

loans.use: To purchasing a 'saj' machine and raw materials for her food production

loans.name: Jessica Yeniz

texts.es:
Jessica es soltera y trabaja en la Parroquia Maria Magdalena donde desempeña como secretaria. Jessica vende ropa variada, zapatos, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito. Jessica solicita un crédito de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, chompas.
Jessica sueña con tener un negocio grande y tener una tienda de ropa.
Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino
texts.en:
Jessica is single and works in the Maria Magdalena Parish where she serves as secretary. Jessica sells clothes, shoes, and other products to family and acquaintances. Her sales are greatly are on credit. Jessica requests a loan of 2000 soles which she invested in the purchase of pants, shirts, and sweaters. Jessica hopes to have a large business, a clothing store. She is a member of the Divine Love Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polos, pants and sweaters

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en:
Toreka L. is 46 and married with 6 children (ages 7-26).  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear). Toreka has 4 years of experience in this business. Toreka needs a loan of WST$2900 to purchase additional fabrics & materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Toreka joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Toreka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 3 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is the coordinator of her group, Camino D. Victoria 3 (Road to victory). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house and to give a better life to her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy cooking.

Luisa is excited to be taking her first loan, with which she will start her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying miscellaneous products, especially clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and to invest more in her business.

Luisa is dreaming of having her own home and, thanks to her business and to Esperanza loans, she wishes that her dream will become reality.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to go forward with starting her business and be in a program like Esperanza offers. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Her group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and an area famous for its tobacco and beef production. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy clothing and underwear to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom has a small business selling clothing. She is married with one son and has been in business for nine years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. 

Dilorom has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of clothing to sell so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et   4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Begnena, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe de femmes sont  le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KARIATOU S., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are all married women who are on the average 37 years old, with four children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Begnena, a village in the Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal to be able to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season. They cultivate pearl millet, peanuts and beans. They are now on their fifth agricultural loan, with all previous loans duly repaid. With this new loan, Kariatou S., the group’s leader, plans to purchase agricultural inputs and small tools as well as pay for the labor to work a peanut field of about 1 hectare [2.5 acres]. After harvesting, the produce is sold in the towns of Diola and Massigui, to a customer base composed of both men and women. After this season, the group members plan to achieve an average revenue of about 35,000 West African Francs each.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, agricultural inputs and small tools

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia L. is from the village of Palattao. She is 48 years old and is married with two adult children. Lucia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Lucia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

 El socio es el Sr. Buenaventura; El socio tiene 72 años de edad;  el socio es casado; El  socio se dedica a la atención de su restaurante chicharroneria junto a su esposa, ellos juntos atienden a sus clientes y disfrutan de lo que tienen y hacen. El socio desea el préstamo para los insumos y mejorar la decoración del local, comprando mezas y sillas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y sillas y mezas para mejorar el local.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA." This bank is located in the district of Saylla in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Buenaventura. He is 72 years old and is married. The member works in his chicharroneria (restaurant that serves chicharrones, something like pork rinds) with his wife. Together they attend to their customers and enjoy what the have and make. The member wants this loan for consumables and to improve the decoration of the location by buying tables and chairs. The member requests the loan to invest in buying consumables, chairs and table to improve the premises. 

The member appreciates and values the loan bestowed to him through this method and in the same way he promises to fulfill the payments in the established period.
