loans.use: To invest in buying consumables, chairs and tables to improve the premises.

loans.name: Bayardo Javier

texts.es: Bayardo Javier tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de medicamentos naturales. El siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, el es un joven muy responsable y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas. Es de manera ambulante en los buses pues es aquí donde obtiene una gran variedad de clientes. Sueña con sacar adelante su familia y espera que sus hijos logren ser profesionales. El financiamiento es para la compra de medicamentos pues actualmente posee varios pedidos.
texts.en: Bayardo Javier is 31 years old and he sells natural medicines.  He is always looking for a way to increase his income and it is not the first time that he is requesting a loan.  He has had this business for more than 6 years and he is a very responsible young man who has proved that he makes his loan repayments.  He sells the medicines traveling on buses and here is where he gets a great variety of customers.  He dreams of helping his family progress and he hopes that his children are able to be professionals.  The loan is for the purchase of medicines because he currently has several requests.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God’S Blessing Group

texts.en:
Everlyn G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing.  She is 40 years old, widowed, and has five children whose ages are between 21 and 3 years. She was able to attend school only through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For five years, she has been operating a pastry business in Redlight outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 28,000 LRD group loan to buy more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.  

She describes herself as an honest and friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.name: 08.08.01 Group

texts.en:
Lai N. T. is a 45 year-old femaL. living in the town of TP Thanh Hoa.  Lai is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.08.01-Dong Ve.


Lai is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Lai owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL..  Lai has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lai is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Quyet is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Thuy is a 46 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Lan is a 46 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Bon is a 46 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  B. T. Hien is a 63 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
M. Florence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Florence has a beauty salon business, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a dryer and hair pomade.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: a dryer, hair pomade

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito B. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Pepito owns & operates a specialized retail store where he buys and sells fruit like mangoes, apples & watermelons. Pepito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Pepito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruit like lanzones & oranges. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like lanzones & oranges to buy and sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fish. She lives in Purok San Pedro Beach, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,200 PHP. Elsie is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to add to her own working capital so she can expand her business operation. This will be her thirteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elsie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty Alexandra

texts.es:
Betty de 32 años, tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos en un puesto de la calle principal de las orquídeas. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha hecho que el negocio de mariscos vuelva a tener ingresos ya que uno de sus amigos fue el primer dueño pero como le dio una mala administración no tuvo suficientes ingresos y quebró. Desde ese tiempo ella tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien con las ventas de pescado de todo tipo.  

Tiene variedad en el pescado por eso quiere seguir trabajando en este ambiente ya que ha tenido ingresos para mantener a su familia pero para mejorar su estilo de vida quiere el préstamo para mejorar su casa comprando con el dinero cemento, bloques arena. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para mejorar las ventas de mariscos.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old.  She has a business selling seafood from a stall on the main road in Las Orquídeas.  She lives with her husband and two children.

Through hard work and commitment, Betty's seafood business is once again making a profit.  One of Betty's friends was the business' first owner.  However, as he ran it badly, he didn't make enough profit and he went bust.  Since that time, Betty has owned the business and it has done very well.  She sells all kinds of fish.

Betty offers a variety of fish and would like to continue working in this business since she makes enough profits to support her family.  However, in order to improve her lifestyle, she would like to take a loan to improve her home, using her money to buy cement, blocks and sand.  In the future, she would like to buy a truck to improve her seafood sales.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

Kenneth has operated an electronics shop for the past two years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Kenneth faces a major challenge of competition from other technicians in the area. He hopes to be self reliant in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase cables and switches for his electronics shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase cables and switches for his electronics shop

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en: Pisi is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children and owns a house in Kasese. She has been in charcoal sales for two years starting with a capital of 500,000 shillings but now it has reached 1,200,000 shillings. Her hardship is lack of enough customers and her vision is business expansion. Pisi intends to use the loan to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: Buying charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with two boys; they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a traditional palm wine selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her local villagers. She was operating a food stall business before she started selling palm wine. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling to many customers in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to renovate her pub and purchase mugs for use in her pub. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her pub and purchase mugs for use in her pub.

loans.name: Quibranza Group

texts.en: Nellie is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old and is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. Nellie is married and has seven adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Nellie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and was used as working capital. Nellie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell at her general store

loans.name: Turyakira

texts.en:
G. Turyakira sells produce such as maize, coffee, beans, and so on, at the Nyakarambi Trading Centre. He is 49 years old and is a father to 6 children, 4 of whom are in school.  He also takes care of other dependents. 

G. started his produce selling business 3 years ago.  He also distills waragi and sell matooke from his farm. He is very hard working and got the idea of doing these businesses from his fellow farmers.  His dream is to be able to grow his businesses and improve his family’s standard of living. 

G. is a new client of Pearl Micro Finance's and he hopes to get better as he services his loan. He needs a loan to buy more maize, coffee and beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy more maize, coffee and beans to sell

loans.name: John Mhar

texts.en:
John Mhar A. is from the village of Poblacion, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 27 years old. John Mhar is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, he owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. His wife manages their retail store while he works as a security guard in a private institution.  He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, John Mhar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

John Mhar is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase more canned goods, snack foods & beverages to resell. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy more inventory for his general store

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 28 ans, Mme Adjo est mère d’un enfant et couturière  de profession. Son conjoint est magasinier. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat d’une machine pour plinthe  car aimerait parfaire ses finitions. Elle est dans ce métier depuis 04 ans. Toute son activité est basée sur place. Elle aimerait plus tard créer sa propre marque de vêtement et se faire connaître à l’international.
texts.en: Married and aged 28, Mrs. Adjo is the mother of one child and a trained seamstress. Her husband is a storekeeper. She is requesting this loan to buy a specialty sewing machine for hems because she would like to be able to finish her clothing herself. She has been in this trade for four years. All her business is done right where she lives. Later on, she would like to create her own trademark for clothing and be known internationally.

loans.use: to buy a specialty sewing machine for hems.

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en: Yuth, age 63, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Yuth is a housewife, while her husband is a security guard at the temples, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved because Yuth’s husband is employed. She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is married with three school-aged children. Valentin is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 10 years.

Valentin is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm. Valentin hopes this loan will expand his operations. Currently, Valentin earns Php 30,000 every crop season in this field of work.

In the future, Valentin hopes that his farm will improve to be able to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Marelis

texts.es:
Marelis  es una mujer D. 57 años que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades D. 28 a 35 años, en San Jacinto un municipio del departamento D. Bolívar, destacado por la variedad D. hamacas y artesanías que fabrican sus habitantes en tejido vertical, como parte D. sus tradiciones culturales.
Marelis aprendió la confección D. ropa como su actividad preferida desD. muy  joven;  a los 17 años en forma empírica  la practicaba apoyada por una vecina y hace cuatro años, realizó varios cursos con el SENA para perfeccionar su arte y emprender en su propio taller,  un negocio ubicado en su vivienda  a través del cual  produce uniformes escolares, actividad a la que ha agregado una comercial relacionada con este mismo proceso, pues también venD. tela y accesorios a otras modistas D. la región y productos cosméticos por catálogos; en la actualidad cuenta con maquinaria suficiente para aumentar sus ventas y eso es justamente lo que quiere que le ocurra permanentemente. Cuando es temporada donD. se incrementan sus ventas, marelis contrata a otras personas para trabajar y desea sostener empleos en su negocio. 
La actividad D. confecciones desarrollada en su taller,  le ha facilitado  sacar adelante a sus hijos y le genera la mayor parte D. los ingresos familiares, pues con esta esta y el apoyo D. su esposo han logrado  adquirir su casa  propia. Marelis está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desD. hace 5 años organización con la que ha recibido 5 financiamientos; su credikiva es el sexto y con él comprará materiales para uniformes escolares y accesorios para la venta en su pequeño punto comercial D. insumos D. confecciones y también otras mercancías que venD. mediante guías especializadas como cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, colonias y perfumes.  Su sueño más adelante se centra en  tener una casa en la ciudad D.  Cartagena, para que cuando los nietos ingresen a la Universidad, tengan donD. vivir y respecto a su capital D. trabajo, incrementarlo para   conseguir nuevos clientes que a su vez apoyen el logro D. una mayor rentabilidad, que en la actualidad se encuentra en un  27%  y con su ejercicio D. trabajo disciplinado y persistente muy seguramente aumentará
texts.en:
Marelis is a 57 year old woman who lives with her husband and their three children, who range in age from 28 to 35.  They live in the San Jacinto municipality in the Bolívar department.  It is known for the variety of hammocks and handicrafts the population makes with a vertical loom as part of their cultural tradition.  

Marelis learned to make clothes as her preferred activity when she was very young.  When she was 17 years old she got practical experience with a neighbor’s help.  Four years ago she took various courses with SENA (National Education Service) in order to perfect her art and start her own shop.  Her business is located in her house, where she makes school uniforms.  She has expanded this aspect of the business beyond making school uniforms.  She also sells fabric and accessories to other dressmakers in the region.  Additionally, she sells cosmetics by catalog.

She currently has enough machines to increase her sales, and that is exactly what she wants to do.  During her high sales season, Marelis hires other people to work.  She hopes to be able to sustain these jobs.

The business activity of making clothes developed in her workshop.  It has facilitated getting her children ahead.  It also generates the major part of the family income.  With this and the support of her husband, they have managed to get their own home.

Marelis has worked with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for five years.  She has received five loans from this organization.  Her Kiva loan is her sixth, and she will use it to buy materials to make more school uniforms and accessories to sell at her small shop.        

Her dream for later on is to have a house in the city of Cartagena.  She wants this for her grandchildren when they enroll in the University.  That way they will have a place to live.  She also dreams of increasing her working capital in order to get new customers, which will in turn result in greater profitability than the current 27%.  With her disciplined work and her persistence it will surely increase.

loans.use: to buy materials for school uniforms and accessories to sell at her shop and also women's accessories, cologne and perfume.

loans.name: Jafesa

texts.en:
Jafesa, aged 29, is married with two children both of whom attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for four years. His farm currently produces eggs and maize which are sold to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Jafesa has made a loan request of 35,000 Kes in order to purchase additional stock of poultry and poultry feed. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. His primary challenges have been diseases, insufficient poultry feed and the fluctuation in the market prices of farm products. In future, he would like to expand his poultry farm and venture into dairy farming as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional poultry and poultry feed.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, 4 D. ellos independientes y uno aún estudiando. Luisa no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace seis años,  su primer préstamo fue por la suma D.  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comida.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará papa, chuño, una caja D. aceite, un paquete D. sal, carne, trucha, queso, etc., la señora nos cuenta que sus ventas las realiza todos los días en la Panamericana y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él es agricultor.
Su sueño es tener una tienda D. abarrotes, cuenta que está cansada D. trabajar en este negocio, le duele la columna, por eso quiere cambiar D. negocio, ver uno más tranquilo y que no le demanD. cargar peso.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para las socias, la facilidad del préstamo y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa"  ["Miraculous Medal"] Communal Bank, located in the district of Pomata, province of Chucuito, and department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are independent and one is still in school. Luisa does not have any education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years now. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her food sales business.

With this new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy potatoes, potato flour, a box of oil, a packet of salt, meat, trout, cheese, etc. She tells Movimiento Manuela Ramos that she makes her sales every day along the Panamerican Highway, and that he husband - a farmer - helps her with the business.

Her dream is to have a grocery story. She explains that she is tired of working in this business. Her back hurts and she would therefore like to change her business to something more tranquil and that doesn't require lifting heavy loads.

She enjoys meetings with her communal bank because it is a distraction for all of the members, for the ease of the loan process, and for the ability to save money.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, potato flour, a box of oil, a packet of salt, meat, trout, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is divorced and has one child. She sells wax prints at Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years. She gets support form her ex-husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. Amina will use the loan to purchase more wax prints to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Amina plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more lengths of wax print to resell.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 40 years old. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Be's husband works as a tailor. Be also earns an income to support her family by sewing clothes at her house.

Be has requested a loan to invest in their businesses by buying better quality fabrics and clothing materials to sell. She hopes that this will enable them to better serve their current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of their businesses. Be hopes their businesses run smoothly and will help her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: La Pitaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo pitaya lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mayra del Socorro quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales y todos los derivados del cerdo y fritanga…etc. desde hace 8 años. Ella con el crédito comprará cerdo, cebolla, chiltoma…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Martha Nubia quien vende cosméticos y ropa y Rosa María quien vende fritanga, crema, queso y cuajada…etc.
texts.en: The group "Pitaya" is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising women.  One of these is Mayra del Socorro, who has had a business making nacatamales (a type of tamale typical of the region), dishes made of pork, and fried foods for 8 years.  With this loan she will buy pork, onions, chiltoma peppers, and other items.  The other members of the group are Martha Nubia, who sells cosmetics and clothing, and Rosa Maria, who sells fried foods, cream, cheese, milk curd, and other items.

loans.use: to buy pork, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Eliezer

texts.es: Manuel usará el crédito para pagar un Postgrado en Contabilidad, ya tiene su carrera universitaria pero desea seguir especializándose, para alcanzar mayor grado profesional. Su madre le inspira a seguir estudiando porque ha trabajado mucho para poder darle una educación, y ahora que ya tiene trabajo le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Las dificultades que tiene son la falta de dinero para poder pagar sus estudios de una vez. Espera poder lograr las metas que se ha fijado en su vida, y está seguro lo logrará a través del estudio.
texts.en:
Manuel will use the loan to pay for a post-graduate degree in Accounting, as he has his undergraduate degree but wants to continue specializing and achieve a higher professional level.

His mother has inspired him to continue studying, as she has worked a lot to be able to give him an education, and currently she has work that helps her cover the household expenses.

The difficulties he faces are his lack of money to be able to pay for his studies.  He hopes to be able to achieve the goals that he has set for his life, and is confident that he will be able to accomplish this through his studies.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate degree in Accounting.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 48 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de cerdos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica esta actividad, Ella dio inicio vendiendo helados y pan fue así que empezó a sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar, fue por medio de su familia que ella aprendió el negocio de la venta y compra de cerdos, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben la buena calidad de productos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos. Sueña con seguirle brindando a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 48 years old. Her business is the buying and selling of pigs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She started by selling ice cream and bread, and in this way she began to cope with household expenses. Through her family she learned the business of buying and selling pigs, so the majority of her clients know about the good quality of her products. The purpose of the loan is to buy pigs. She dreams of continuing to provide necessary income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Helen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Helen,  tiene como actividad la consultoría en educación superior,  actividad que realiza durante la semana  dictando clases en diferentes institutos de la ciudad de La Paz.
La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo  y ella, es una familia joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella  y su familia, el esposo trabaja  en una empresa de crianza y pesca de truchas, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mobiliario para su oficina que esta instalando para desarrollar mejor su actividad y brindar apoyo a otras instituciones educativas.
texts.en: Helen is a higher education consultant, an activity she carries out during the week teaching classes in various institutes in the city of La Paz.  Her family consists of her husband and herself; it’s a young family with a strong drive to succeed in life.  This activity is her main source of income for herself and for her family.   Her husband works at a trout farm.  The loan is going to be used to buy furniture for the office she’s opening to better carry out her activity and provide support to other educational institutions.

loans.use: to buy office furniture.

loans.name: Tolobek's Group

texts.en:
Tolobek is a member of this group. He is 50 and he has three children. His daughter studies at the university and the two other children work in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Two years ago because of the high unemployment rate, Tolobek started to breed livestock with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. By reselling livestock after fattening, he earns about 10,000 soms per month to meet the family needs. He applied for the loan because he needs additional money to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, he plans to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Adama.  She is married to a businessman, and has two children aged 8 and 4 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to attend school and also help with domestic work. 

 In 2006, Adama established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business because she did not have anyone to help her continue her education because her parents are poor.  She stated selling doughnut cakes.  She saved Le 700,000 then changed her business into foodstuffs on a small scale, and she has improved over one year into a larger business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

Adama has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase Irish Potatoes - 10 bags @ Le170,000, Onions - 5 bags @ Le90,000, Vinky Eggs - 10 cartons @ Le180,000, with the balance Le 50,000 being for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Adama plans to build a dwelling house for her family. She wants her children to have a good living and education.     She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Irish Potatoes - 10 bags @ Le170,000, Onions - 5 bags @ Le90,000, Vinky Eggs - 10 cartons @ Le180,000 and the balance, Le50,000, is for transport.

loans.name: Babak

texts.en: Babak is a 46-year-old trader who sells beverages and food. He has five years of experience in this field. Babak is very polite and friendly and his attitude to customers makes his business very successful. His monthly income from his business is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). He is married and has four children. He wishes to increase his income which will allow him to improve life conditions of his family. For this purpose he applied for a loan for 1700 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase and diversify goods in his shop. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been selling cooked rice and stew at Kwahinkrom for the past five years. She is married and has four children.  Grace assists her husband in paying utility bills and caring for their children. 

She will use her loan to buy bags of rice. She intends to expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Dulia Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dulia;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16, 12 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores; la socia tiene patos, pavos, gallinas; La socia también se dedica  a la agricultura como actividad principal, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre está ocupada en todo lo que pueda hacer, ella tiene en su propia casa un espacio en el primer piso que vende chicha de jora, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su terreno de cultivo de maíz, también desea invertir en la compra de animales menores como pollos para criar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y animales menores
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Dulia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin” which is located in the District of Arin in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 18, 16, and 12). Dulia raises small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens. She also engages in farming as her main business activity, growing and harvesting corn. Dulia is a hardworking woman who always stays busy in everything that she does. She owns a home and has a space on the first floor where she sells “chicha de jora” (a beverage made from corn). On this occasion, she wants to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to apply on her land for growing corn. Dulia also wants to buy small animals, such as chickens to raise. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers and small animals.

Dulia is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and small animals.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y decidido, así como amable y cordial, es conviviente con Julia, quien es ama de casa. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres con su pareja y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. La actividad que tiene José es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehiculo trimóvil conocido como mototaxi, con el cual recorre todas las calles de la ciudad en zonas céntricas y  alejadas  llevando a sus pasajeros a sus destino. Tiene más de 03 años realizando ésta actividad, en un principio contaba con un mototaxi que compró en la modalidad de alquiler venta. Ahora le gusta su actividad pues le genera un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de alimentación de su familia y apoyar en la economía  en la casa de sus padres, así como poder manejar sus horarios de trabajo. Por el contrario, no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido pues eso dificulta poder realizar su trabajo, ya que se malogra su vehiculo. Por otro lado, desea poder abrir una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde atendería su pareja, de esa manera tendría un ingreso económico extra. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, y se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para implementar un nuevo negocio en una bodega en la casa de sus  padres.
texts.en:
José, who is 36 years old, is a hard-working and determined man, as well as being kind and cordial. He lives with his partner, Julia, who is a housewife,  and their two children, ages 8 and 5, whom he loves very much, in the house of his parents. José's business is transporting passengers in his three-wheeled vehicle, known as a mototaxi, with which he travels through all the streets of the city, both in and away from the center, transporting his passengers to their destinations. He has been doing this work for more than three years. At first he had a mototaxi that he bought through a rent-to-own plan. Now he likes his business since it generates an income with which he can pay the expenses to feed his family and help the finances in his parents' home, and also because he can manage his working hours. In contrast, he doesn't like it when it rains for a long time, since it is difficult to be able to do his work, since it's bad for his vehicle. On the other hand, he wants to be able to open a store in his parents' house, which his partner can tend to. In this way he will have an extra income. 

This will be his fifth loan with MFP. He feels thankful for the financial support to advance in his business, and he promises to be punctual in making his payments, as he did with his previous loans. On the other hand, he says that he feels good about his communal bank since he considers its members to be people who are responsible and united. With the 2000 PEN he has applied for, he will invest in the wholesale purchase of groceries to set up a new business, a grocery store in his parents' house.

loans.use: to buy products to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale fabric

loans.name: Benilda Cristina

texts.es: Benilda  de 55 años se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías, ella vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar,  con su cónyuge y tiene tres hijos en las edades de 31 a 33 años. Cuando inició su negocio, lo hizo por tradición familiar aprendiendo las técnicas del tejido en telar. Posteriormente contrajo matrimonio y apoyó el bienestar de su hogar con su desempeño en las labores artesanales. Sus clientes son los almacenes especializados de manualidades y tejidos, que están ubicados en la carretera donde se acercan los turistas y  también tiene clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla y en Cartagena donde vive su hija.   Benilda es una mujer que está enfocada en el crecimiento de su negocio, por eso ha recibido durante 7 años, seis financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con esta organización ha logrado que sus hijos estudien hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda y tener su propia casa. Su mayor desafío es sacar adelante a su nieta,  pues con la muerte de su hija,  está a cargo de su educación y de su bienestar, pues depende de Benilda. Con su credikiva comprará hilos y otros materiales para hacer mochilas, bolsos, y hamacas en tejido vertical.
texts.en:
Benilda, 55, sells crafts and lives in San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar.  She is married and has three children, ages 31 to 22.  The reason for starting her business was that weaving was a family tradition so she learned the trade.  Then she married and helped cover household expenses through her craft work.  Her customers are craft and fabric shops that are located on the roads where tourists pass by.  She also has customers in the cities of Barranquilla and Cartagena where her daughter lives.

Benilda is a woman who focuses on business growth, and therefore, over the last seven years she has received six loans through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  Through this organization she has been able to provide an education for her children, as well as renovate and own her own home.  Her greatest challenge is taking care of her granddaughter who depends on her for an education and well-being since Benilda's daughter died.

The Credikiva loan will be used to buy yarn and other mateirals to make backpacks, bags and hammocks on the vertical loom.

loans.use: To buy yarn and other materials to make backpacks, bags and hammocks on a vertical loom.

loans.name: Tedis Estela

texts.es:
La joven señora Tedis tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en casa de su madre y se dedica a la elaboracion de golosinas durante los meses en que comprende el año escolar, su clientes son los niños de la escuela de su comunidad, sin embargo durante la epoca que los niños no van a la escuela se dedica a vender ropa nueva y zapatos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y zapatos, desea invertir en zapatos colegiales y ropa tipo uniformes para los niños que estan por entrar a clases.
Su deseo es que su hija cresca sana y fuerte.
texts.en:
Tedis is a young woman of 23. She is a single mother, and lives with her daughter in her mother's house. She works making candy during the months that comprise the school year. Her customers are the school children in the community. 

However, during the time of year that the children don't go to school, she sells new clothing and shoes. She wishes to invest in school shoes, and uniform-type clothing for children who are about to start classes.

Her wish is for her daughter to grow up healthy and strong.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Goundo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  GOUNDO sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans ses  familles monogamiques à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame FATOUMATA fait le commerce des tissus dans le groupe GOUNDO,  elle est   au milieu en position debout.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 pièces de bazin riche au grand marché de la ville  de Bamako.  Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of Goundo Group are married women, who average 30 years of age and four children. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of Mali).

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Past loans were repaid without problems.

Mrs. FATOUMATA is a member of this group who sells fabrics. She's the one standing in the middle in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 pieces of rich damask at the Grand Market in Bamako. She resells her products for cash at a fixed spot at the Grand Market in Sikasso, as well as at her home, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 48), to be used in part tot repay the loan and its interests, and in part to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of rich damask

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Adela. I sell canned goods and spices to add flavor to the meals. I distribute them myself to different places. I’ve been in this type of business for several years. With my income, I can cover my family’s and other expenses. For health reasons, my husband can’t work, so with this business and my kids’ help in their free time we will be able to get ahead.

Loan Use: Purchase spices, flaxseed, saffron, cinnamon, cloves, black pepper, etc.

Mi Nombre es Adela, tengo un negocio de embasado y venta de Condimentos para el buen zazon de las comidas, el que distribuyo de manera ambulantes tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, ya que por razones de salud mi esposo no puede trabajar y con este negocio y con la colaboracion de mis hijos en su tiempo libre podemos salir adelante.

loans.use: Compra de Especias, Achiote, Linaza, azafran,canela, Clavos de olor,Pimienta y otros

loans.name: Brayon

texts.en: I am a married man a father of 4. I do my business in Matayos in the Busia district. I am the main bread earner. I believe the loan will help me to increase my business skills and educate my dependents.

loans.use: I will use the loan to widen my businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy 300 chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Memgoto

texts.fr: Madame Memgoto T. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend du poisson séché dans un marché périphérique de N’Djaména. Quelques fois, elle achète du poisson frais avec les pêcheurs, surtout certaines espèces annuelles, pour les fumer et les conserver pour les revendre plus tard.  Elle sollicite un prêt de $450 pour acheter du poisson frais, les fumer pour les revendre. Avec le commerce du poisson, elle parvient à répondre aux besoins de sa famille, tel que le paiement des frais de scolarité de ses enfants et d’autres choses

loans.use: Achat des caisses de poissons séchés et fumés dans les zones de pêche pour les revendre en détails à N'Djaména

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with 4 grown sons. She runs a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes in one of the local markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. It’s the only source of income for her family. Yevgeniya has been in this business for a long time – about 12 years. She has many loyal customers. Recently, she opened a new sales location which is now the biggest kiosk selling perfumes and beauty items in the market. Nadiya Ukraine loans and Yevgeniya’s personal determination have contributed a lot to the expansion of her small venture. Currently, her gross income is about $8,000. Her customers are very pleased with her work and the quality of service in her kiosk.

Yevgeniya is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her assortment of inventory, purchase new types of products and attract new clients. One of her long-term goals is to become a leading entrepreneur selling this type of merchandise in the market. Yevgeniya is a strong and focused person. She never gives up. Presently, she’s facing a challenging situation in her family as one of her sons is abusing drugs. However, Yevgeniya doesn’t want to get depressed or discouraged but wants to fight for her son’s well-being and healing. We believe her perfect credit history with 15 promptly repaid loans is good proof of Yevgeniya’s trustworthiness and her capability to repay this current loan.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert sells fried Dominican foods such as tostones (fried plantain chips), chicharron (fried pork skin), and other fritters from the side of the road. He has been doing this for 14 years he said, but only with the help of this loan will he finally be able to sell enough that he can begin to save some of his money as well. He lives by himself, and has no wife or children.

His dream is to have a better life, so that before he dies he can own his own house and sleep peacefully each night. Albert is very thankful to everyone who is helping him; although he is old, he knows it's never too late to change.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Carolina Jorge

texts.pt:
Carolina lives in the village of Samora Machel, district of Manjacaze. She is a single mother of 1 son. Her mother and brothers moved in with her after her mother separated from her husband and they currenlty live with her. Carolina joined the program this year. She also works at the village's rural hospital as a janitor. Because her salary is so low, her business helps her supplement her income and support her family. Her mother helps her out by keeping up their small house. Carolina's son and brother are in school. In the future, if her business grows strong, she dreams of building a home made of durable materials for her and her family.

Translated by Camila, Kiva volunteer.

Carolina vive na aldeia Samora Machel no distrito de Manjacaze. Ela e mae solteira e tem 1 filho. Para alem do filho ela vive com a mae e seus irmaos. Isto porque a mae separou-se do marido e veio viver para casa de Carolina. Carolina entrou para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Carolina e tambem trabalhadora do Hospital Rural da vila do mesmo nome como servente. Como servente o seu salario e baixo assim ela reforca o orcamento familiar com o negocio que ela faz. A mae de Carolina ajuda a filha nas despesas trabalhando na pequena machamba familiar. O filho e os irmaos de Carolina estao a estudar. No futuro Carolina diz que se o negocio correr bem e crescer ela sonha en construir uma residencia usando material convencional.

loans.use:
Carolina wants to use the money to buy more clothing for sale.

Carolina quer usar o dinheiro para acompra de mais fardos de roupa para a venda

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati, 43, is a widow with 4 children. Since her husband passed away she has been running a food stall to support her family, sometimes with the help of her children. She usually earns US$10.5 per day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan US$100 to increase her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her food stall

loans.name: Nazila Huseynali

texts.en: Nazila (her sister is pictured)  was born in 1976 and is the mother of 3 children. The Abdullayev family lives in Khudat town. Naziila has 3 years of experience in this business, and the family now needs a loan of $600 to buy a cow in order to produce more milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
I am Sajida Z., a leader of a small group of women: Kishwer, Zahida, Razia, Sajida and Raeesa. I have known these women for a long time and completely trust them. They need loans for the following businesses: Kishwer needs this loan for her family’s garments business; Zahida B. will buy an overlock sewing machine; Raeesa A. will use her share of the loan to repair her family's rickshaw; Razia S. needs this loan to expand her family's oil business; Sajida R. runs a boutique.

Lastly, I am aiming to buy a donkey cart for my husband. Currently he drives a rented cart, and by buying our own we will no longer have to pay the rent. For more income, I stay at home and fix sequins on stoles on order. I have five kids: three boys and two girls. I wish my kids a very bright and sound economic future.

loans.use: Buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Eldar K. was born in 1982 in Agsu, where he still lives. This is the sixth year in a row he has been working in his phone repair business. He is married and has one child. Last year, Eldar applied for a loan from Normicro's Agsu branch. He plans to use the money to repair his store.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Эльдар 1982 года рождения. Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Шестой год подряд работает в этой сфере. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Прошлом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Взяв кредит Эльдар хочеть сделат ремонт в магазине.

loans.use: To repair his shop

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. V. has obtained eight loans with Fundación Leon over the past three years. She has invested this capital to increase the variety of products offered in her small grocery store.

Mrs. Vargas used to rent a house but now her family lives in their own house, thanks to the fruits of her business and support from her husband's work. The couple has two children who also help look over the store.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace uno tres años donde se le han otorgado ocho creditos los que ha utilizado en surtir su negocio de pulperia, ella ha logrado ampliar los productos que vende, anteriormente alquilaba casa, fruto del negocio mas el apoyo de su esposo ha logrado adquirir una vivienda donde vive actualmente, casada con dos hijos los que viven con ella y le ayudan a ver el negocio.

loans.use: Buy products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Señor Estanislao lives with his parents in Heroes del Acre Street, in the neighbourhood of Pura Pura, La Paz. As a student in Information Technology, he rented a store near to the house and installed networked computer games there. This little business provided him with a steady income, and so he decided to open an Internet Café. There are several colleges in his neighbourhood, and there is a need for Internet access.

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a server from which he will run Internet service. His income will increase, and he will be able to pay for his studies, and his daily living expenses such as food etc. His credit history is good, and he qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Estanislao vive en la calle Heroes del Acre de la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres; Estanislao es estudiante de Informática motivo por el cual alquiló una tienda cerca de su casa e instaló juegos en red; este pequeño negocio le dió buenos ingresos y por lo tanto decidió poner un negocio de Internet ya que por su zona hay varios colegios y la necesidad de uso de servicio de Internet.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora que le sirva de servidor e instalar el Internet y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, seguir pagando su estudios y también solventar su alimentación y otros. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a computer server for an Internet Café.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta N., 48, is married with six children. A very energetic mother working hard to support her family, she is supporting her husband, children and as well as her husband's parents. She has many years of experience in the Plantation/ Samoan Bread business. She sells to the general public/villages 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (~$270 USD). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her son's school fees.

loans.use: Elisapeta would like to purchase pesticides and chemicals for her plantation and ingredients for her Samoan Bread business.

loans.name: Juana Gertrudis

texts.es:
Juana Gertrudis is married and 54 years old. She studied up to the 5th year of secondary school, but did not continue studying because she got married. She has 4 children; her 35 year old son is in poor health, but the rest of her children are working.

This businesswoman began selling chicken as well as sandals from her home in the San Pedro de Lloc district of Pacasmayo province in the department of La Libertad, but stopped for a period of time because her mother was ill and she had to take care of her and had no time to work. Later on she started up again and now rents a commercial space where she sells spices and ground chilis as well as chicken.

Her daughter convinced her to participate in the "Libertad" communal bank and with her first loan of 300 soles she bought chicken and plastic sandals. With another loan for 2,500 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy chickens and sacks of whole spices. Juana Gertrudis is currently the secretary for the communal bank and her goal is to fix up her home to make it more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juana Gertrudis está casada, tiene 54 años, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 04 hijos, su hijo de 35 años de edad está delicado de salud, los demás hijos sí trabajan.

La empresaria empezó a vender pollo y también sandalias, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad, por una temporada dejó el negocio porque su mamá estaba enferma se dedicaba a atenderla y no tenía tiempo para trabajar; posteriormente lo retomó y se independizó, ahora alquila un local en donde vende condimentos, ají molido y también pollo.

Su hija la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró pollo y sandalias plásticas. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará pollo y condimentos enteros por sacos. Juana Gertrudis tiene el cargo de secretaria del banco comunal y tiene como meta arreglar su casa para tener más comodidad.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and spices.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada was born in 1977 and she is married. She lives with her family in Gračanica. She does the weave of sheets and small carpets, selling to her constant stream of customers.

With this loan in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900) she intends to buy new wool and cotton for her business. She wants to make new weave products and to expand her offerings in order to help her household with the money.

loans.use: To buy wool and cotton.

loans.name: Hodales

texts.es: Hodales a sus 27 años es madre de 2 dos hijos, los mismos que están estudiando y gracias a su negocio puede suplir sus necesidades, por más que sea duro su trabajo. Ella es propietaria de un taller de carpintería, donde su esposo Guido es el carpintero, fabrican mesas, sillas, camas, cómodas, etc. Así como también brindan servicios de carpintería a muchas instituciones o para quienes lo soliciten. Hodales  quiere crecer su negocio, pues en la actualidad no cuenta con muchas herramientas, además de implementarse con más madera ya que es su materia prima de trabajo, por este motivo solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Hodales at her 27 years is a mother of 2 two children who are students. Thanks to her business she can supply their needs, no matter how hard be her work. She is an owner of a carpentry workshop, where her husband Guido is the carpenter. They make tables, chairs, beds, chests of drawers, etc. In addition they offer carpentry services to many institutions or whoever requests it. Hodales wants to grow their business. They currently do not have many tools nor do they have sufficient wood, which is their main work commodity. For that reason she requests this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools and a larger quantity of wood for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Mr. Tey V. was born in 1965 and now he lives in Chrap village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. He faces a small problem to his production because the rice is not growing well. He does not earn enough money for living from rice cultivation. Thus, Mr. Tey V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his field. He is a father of three children, who are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Out Sothea, is a vegetable seller and is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support to his field.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. lives in a small village where farming is the major source of income. She is 50 years old and single so she lives with her immediate family.  

Evangeline wants to help her nieces in their studies, so she has started a business selling personal care products such as perfume and lotion, as well as apparel for children such as slippers, shoes, and bags.  

Her loan request of Php5, 000 will be used to purchase additional merchandise to expand her business. Through this, she expects that her sales and her income will increase. She hopes that her business will thrive so she can continue to help her nieces financially in providing them with a daily school allowance.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Akouvi Yanamè

texts.fr:
Madame Akouvi Yamani est âgée de trente huit ans, elle réside dans le quartier d’Agoè, elle exerce dans la restauration, elle a un  bar qu’elle  a nommée « BAR LES EPERVIERS ». Elle est très dynamique et tient son bar depuis 2006 dans le quartier d’agbalepedo un quartier au nord de Lomé (Togo). Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000f de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursée et sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de riz, 08 cartons de couscous, 15 cartons de spaghetti et 12 cartons de poissons.
Elle est célibataire et a deux (02) enfants à charge, avec le profit tiré de ce commerce, elle pense bien subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 38 years old and lives in the Agoè region. She is involved in the restaurant trade and has a bar named “Bar Les Éperviers” (Sparrowhawk Bar). She is very dynamic and has operated her bar since 2006 in the Agbalepedo area in northern Lomé in Togo. She has already taken out a loan for 300,000 XOF with WAGES which she repaid in full. She is requesting this second loan so she can buy 15 sacks of rice, eight cartons of couscous, 15 cartons of spaghetti, and 12 cartons of fish. She is unmarried and has two children under her care. With the money she makes from her business, she hopes to be able to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Margina

texts.es: Margina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultora, cultiva los productos nativos de su región, como la papa y el maíz, con esta actividad económica ha podido sostener a su familia, ya que con la cosecha la vende en el mercado. Años anteriores le ha traído buenas ganancias dedicarse a esta actividad, pero últimamente, debido a las condiciones climáticas, ha notado que sus ingresos han bajado considerablemente, por lo que recientemente Margina ha optado por sembrar alfalfa, que es el alimento para los animales, que le resulta más rentable cosecharla a menudo y venderla por paquetes. Dentro de sus planes está la implementación de su propia granja de animales menores en su casa. Es la primera vez que Margina tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, que es la razón predominante por la cual fue aceptada a ser una integrante más de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de animales menores; como pollos y cuyes, los comprará por docenas para iniciarse en la crianza y venta de animales.
texts.en:
Margina is 53 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has been a farmer for 20 years, growing crops native to her area, such as potato and corn. This has sustained her family as she sells her harvest at market. In previous years, this was a good way to make a living but lately, because of weather conditions, she has noticed a sharp drop in her revenues. Margina has therefore decided to sow alfalfa, which is used to feed animals as it is more profitable to harvest it often and sell by bales. As part of her plans, she intends to start a business raising small animals at home. This is the first time Margina is getting a loan from MFP. She is committed to pay on time, which is why she has been accepted as a member of her community bank. She will invest the loan in the purchase of small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she will buy by the dozen in order to start up her animal-raising and sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a business raising small animals.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Juan Francisco U. tiene 48 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la compra y venta de cerdo, y la ubicación de su negocio está en una finca. Hace cinco anos que tiene este negocio, y Don Juan lo inició porque tuvo unos amigos que le aconsejaron que este tipo de negocio le podía ayudar a generar los ingresos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. El propósito de Don Juan es de comprar más cerdos en esta temporada ya que estos tienen diferentes utilidades. Por esta razón, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo designado a la compra de repuestos de su carretón, y además de eso lo ocupa para el traslado de los cerdos. Al final, sus deseos son de mantener este negocio ya que con este, él gana ingresos extras los cuales le permite dar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco U. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Juan’s economic activity involves the purchase and sale of pigs, and the location of his business is at a farm. He has had the business for five years, having started because he had some friends who advised him that this type of enterprise would help him generate enough income to support his family. Juan’s intention is to purchase more pigs during this season, as they serve various functions. For this reason, the financing is to provide him with working capital designed to purchase spare parts for his trailer. The trailer also helps him with the transport of the pigs. Finally, his wishes are to maintain the business since it earns him extra income that allows him to provide additional comforts for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id:
Dari Pinjaman periode yang pertama yang telah diterima oleh Ni ketut Sudantri dan yang sudah dipergunakan untuk membeli anakan babi dan induk babi.Hasil yang didapat dari usaha ini cukup baik karena Ni Ketut Sidantri melakukan segala petunjuk cara pemeliharaan babi yang  bimbingan oleh dokter Hewan dan pembina dari DINARI.  Hasil yang diperoleh ini dipergunakan untuk menambah jumlah Anakan babi yang bisa dipelihara dan juga untuk membiayai uang sekolah anaknya yang masih bersekolah
Untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini Ni Ketut Sudantri akan mempergunakan  pinjamannya untuk membeli Anakan Babi yang akan dipelihara selama 5 bulan dengan harapan penghasilanya akan lebih meningkat.
texts.en:
From the first round of loan, Ni ketut Sudantri has use it to buy piglets and sow. It was fruitful as she was given guidance on rearing them from Dinari's Vetrianry. The profit was used to buy new piglets and as well for the use of her children who are still studying. For the second round of loan she intend to use it to buy more piglets and pig feedings and rear them for 5 months, and hopes that her profit will increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: M. Rose is the leader of the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. She is a business lady with a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. Rose says that before the loans, she always figured out what she would sell out to her customers, and this mostly happened because she did not have enough capital. Then there was not a lot of competition in her area. But the use of loans helped her to include more goods on her shop shelves and now she is happy that although there are bigger shops in her neighborhood, she can afford to sell and make a weekly profit of 40000 Ushs and save for her family and future developments. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop.

loans.use: Restocking Rose's retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Yeral Walberto

texts.es:
El señor Yeral R. en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León ha iniciado la obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda el cual ha logrado llevar a cabo con mucho esfuerzo.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con dicha obra como lo es la puesta del piso y por esto requiere del crédito para así finalizar su obra y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeral R. lives in the Telica district of the city of León and, with much effort, has begun the work of remodeling his home.

He has come to CEPRODEL today with the desire to obtain a loan to purchase the construction materials necessary to continue the work of laying a floor in his home. He needs a loan to complete the project and provide better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has been selling aluminum for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as from surrounding regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum.

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 13 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan R. is 53 years old and is married to Mrs. Rufina Ferreira, with whom he has three older daughters. Mr. Juan produces cheese and also sells milk. He has been working in this business since 2000, thanks to help from his brother, who worked in an upholstery shop. It was due to this income that they bought a cow with a calf to start the business.

Currently he is also working to make leather footwear, which provides a large amount of income. Thanks to his work, his daughters were able to continue their education, and now they live on their own.

The credit applied for is for the purchase of cow fodder, so that the cattle can be well fed and produce quality milk.

loans.use: To purchase cow fodder

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé en 2007 le commerce de bijoux, elle s’approvisionne au Ghana, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle vend ses marchandises aux bonnes dames du grand marché de Lomé. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit lui permettant d’acheter 4 cartons de bijoux de nouvelles gammes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started a jewelry business in 2007. She supplies herself from Ghana, so she manages to realize a larger profit margin on her sales. She sells her merchandise to women at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The inventory currently at her disposal does not allow her to respond to customer demand. This is the reason behind her inquiry with WAGES. She is asking for her first loan to buy four boxes of new assortments of jewelry. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja en L. casa D. sus padres y tiene una hija que es el motor D. su trabajo. Él se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte público y a enseñar danzas. Cuando empezó con el transporte no contaba con L. licencia D. conducir ni con el permiso D. L. municipalidad, por lo que tenía muchas dificultades para trabajar. Posteriormente con el apoyo D. su padre logró regularizar todos sus documentos, por ello le da una parte D. las ganancias D. su trabajo como alquiler del motocarro, pues el vehículo es D. su padre. Pero con lo que José se siente más identificado es con las danzas y constantemente se capacita en diversas coreografías actuales. Además, también alquiL. los trajes para los danzantes, lo que le permite acumular más ganancias. Con estas dos actividades es con las que José mantiene a su familia, siendo su próxima meta L. construcción D. su casa propia. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los periodos concluidos demostró pagar a tiempo todas las cuotas, además sus compañeros le tienen mucho aprecio por ser el presidente D. su banco comunal y siempre los orienta para que tomen decisiones acertadas. El dinero que solicita lo piensa utilizar en el incremento D. los disfraces típicos que alquiL., con otra parte pagará el cambio D. un repuesto del motocarro con el que trabaja.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, lives with his partner at his parents’ house, and has one daughter who is the driving force behind his work. He dedicates himself to providing public transportation services and teaching dance. When he started in transportation, he didn’t have a license or the necessary municipal approvals, which maD. it very difficult to work. Later, with his father’s support, he managed to obtain all the necessary documentation. He pays a part of his earnings towards renting his motocar, as it belongs to his father. However, what José most identifies with is dance and he is always choreographing new dances. Teaching dance generates additional income for him, but he also has to rent dance costumes. His two activities allow him to support his family, and his next goal is to build his own home. This is his ninth credit with MFP, and his past record demonstrates that he complies with his payments. In addition, his friends greatly appreciate him as he is the president of their cooperative bank and he always helps guiD. them towards good decision-making. He plans to use some of the funds he is requesting to rent more traditional dance outfits, and the rest to pay off a repair on his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar and buy dance costumes.

loans.name: Nyame Som Pa Group

texts.en:
M. is forty years old. He is married and has nine children who are all still in school. He is a petty trader. He sells cereals. He supplies to local food vendors.

M. is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Som Pa’. He is the man seated in front in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and/or farmers.
